QJ_v-Y24MX2oW-p6Ag0txw.text: Found this place through Groupon and came out for dinner with a group of business partners. Although I like those deals I'm always a bit bit weary that I may get blindsided with disappointed. Therefore I cross reference with Yelp! Fellow yelpers are totally on point with how fabulous the location is. The view of the planes taking off (and at dusk) was spectacular. So big thumbs up for that! The service was very good, Cash was our server. We had a bit of confusion with our groupon and he was very helpful in resolving the matter smoothfully. Being an Atlanta Native I've been lucky emough to experience dozens of Indian restaurants (ie.street food, Gujurati vegeterian, North and South Indian to name some) so the food did not get me too hyped up. It was descent, the spices we're a bit off for my taste. I can def say that their portions are very nice. We ordered 5 meat entrees, 4 vegetarian, an order of Nan and a Roti, and 3 appetizers. The white rice was a complimentary, and 4 were brought to us. We had two bags full of to go containers filled to the top with a little of everything. This was enough food for another full meal for all 7 of us. Side note-the roti was not the type of roti we expected to get. It was more like a lighter and crispier version of their nan. So their spices weren't my fav, but for sure expect a great view, some good service and tons of food!

4ooIY_Imw0WAghkavQl6cA.text: I would say that this place combines the three things I enjoy most - amazing service, great food and hookah.  So lets go a bit into more detail on each one:  Amazing service - This place has a great staff that really knows how to take care of their customers.  My friend and I spent quite a bit of time talking with the owner who is an amazing and very interesting guy.  Service is super fast and very attentive.    Great food - There is a reason why all reviews rant and rave about the food at this place.  The menu has authentic Indian cuisine done to perfection.  I definitely want to stop by here for lunch to try their Lunch Buffet.  Hookah - If you are a hookah person this is among the top three places in the valley.  This is the only one that I know that will serve hookah in a quiet, intimate atmosphere where you can go and enjoy the hookah with friends or on a date and don't have to worry about loud music and a bunch of underage kids.  Also the only place in the valley to serve all glass hookah for the price of what you would usually get a regular hookah for.    PS.  One thing I have not mentioned is the view.  This is the only place in the valley that has a perfect view of the airport and the strip.  You won't find that ANYWHERE else.

tYumnDveXKURW5LO-4wyHg.text: I'm an extremely picky eater, always have been, always will be. Doesn't mean I won't try a new spot out though, I'm always looking for that hidden gem! Well, to say the least, this spot won't let you down if you are craving -   A) Authentic Indian Food B) Phenomenal Service  C) Unbelievable Views  Situated in a nice little shopping center on the 2nd floor, Pure looks right out at the airport as well as the strip, leaving you with an unobstructed view of Las Vegas as well as the ability to watch planes land and take off, quite fantastic to be honest.   The food, well the food was awesome. The chicken curry, definitely hit the spot and the spices left my mouth tingling in every right way!   As awesome as the food was, what really took an already fantastic Indian spot to a whole new level even for Vegas terms, was the service! Mani! This guy is determined to to make sure this restaurant remains successful. He recommended what to get, we got it, and HE DID NOT LET US DOWN! Genuinely a good man, we were able to talk about anything and everything with him and he made sure every step of the way we were 110% satisfied, no matter the request.   We took out a long time employee from Mexico, who thought he knew spices like no other, but he had never tried Indian. The goal of outspicing Jesse... Accomplished!!  Thanks so much Mani as well as the other gentlemen of Pure Indian!

MfjxPT--H4vLMT07Xr6jig.text: Came in at 1:00 am & the owner was so accommodating!! Plus the food is amazing... We ordered naan, phatura, chicken tikka masala, bangen bartha, chole, & ras malai for dessert! The view is beautiful you have a great clear view of the strip. Recommend this place 100% if you like Indian food you will love  this place!

HXJiGLN4p6R1kzBXPy5kWw.text: I've tried to cater food twice from this place and both timed were failures...  The first time was for a wedding and we pre-ordered some snacks including samosas, various pakoras, and chicken tikka. We placed the order about a week in advance, and deposited half. When we showed up to pick up the food at the agreed time, they told us that the food wasn't ready and we would have to come back in 1 hour. No big deal - we came back and got the food. When we came home, we realized that they didn't give us our full order! Since we were already an hour late, we just let it be.   The second time, we only catered 50 samosas. We prepaid in full about 3 weeks before the event. When I showed up to pick up the samosas, they didn't have it ready and told me that they didn't even have the normal samosas, and instead only had the tiny triangle ones and will give me 150 of those for the same price I paid....those triangle ones cost $4.99 for a pack of 100 and they were trying to charge me $50. The people said they didn't have my order, so I showed them my receipt and told them I paid in full. Instead of making it right, they hassled me about giving me a refund and tried to get me to take something I didn't want...  Pure India was better when they first started, but due to the negative experience with catering, I can't recommend them at all.

blOxYgVYGcRMAnLVszss1w.text: I had a Groupon for this restaurant and decided to check it out with my brother. It can be slightly confusing to find this restaurant since the lit-up sign does not actually say "Pure Indian Cuisine," but just follow the paper signs up to the entrance on the second floor. The atmosphere is quite modern and hip, and there are large windows with amazing views of the airport tarmac just across the street. This would make a great date place!  We were given some complimentary papadam to start, which also came with mint and tamarind chutneys. Service was friendly. I will say that it took quite a while before our food came out, but I suppose they make everything to order.  Unfortunately, the portions were not the biggest, so even after two entrees and an order of garlic naan, my brother and I were not full. The garlic naan was a decent size (four pieces) for the price though, and the eggplant and chicken dishes we ordered were very flavorful and tasty.   There was also live music when we visited, which was nice.  Overall, this is a very pleasant restaurant, but maybe consider coming for the lunch buffet if you are super hungry; it would yield better bang for your buck.

w2DDsx_uiUl2Zi8VFcxJGw.text: Such great food! I've been here a few times and they never disappoint!   The naan bread is delicious and the chicken korma is so creamy! LvhjYSZ0wfN6XJ9LkT9i9g.text: Funny how I wouldn't give a flying fig about watching airplanes take off/land at the airport, yet move the view a couple miles south of McCarran Airport with the smell of naan and tandoori chicken floating around and now I'm all like "Well!! This is niiice!".  Not having luggage really does make all the difference.  Entrees for dinner are a couple of dollars more than other places, but they do make up for it with slightly larger portions and some seriously delicious fare.  Their version of chicken korma was fantastic.  The nutty cashew flavor was definitely amplified and those occasional hits of raisins were like lapdances to my taste buds.    Even though our other entree was billed as "Palak Paneer", which is supposed to be all spinach, less creamy, and no garlic, the server informed us that they used saag for this dish.  That was fine by us as it was still very good.  I appreciated the slight coarseness of the greens and the firmer than usual blocks of paneer.    I would choose a meal here over 70% of the eateries at the nearby Town Square and look forward to crushing the lunch buffet soon.

AWz05bTvnssofOM44Ts_Qw.text: Indian cuisine is an interesting category on Yelp. I feel as though a lot of non-Indians in certain parts of the U.S. really haven't experienced truly outstanding Indian food, so they don't have much of a frame of reference when reviewing Indian restaurants.  If you ate at Pure and felt you had great Indian food, then you're going to be truly blown away when you finally do eat great Indian food. You didn't have it at Pure though.  As someone who's lived in India and also eaten some of the best Indian food in the U.S., I continue to be extremely disappointed by the quality of the Indian food offerings in Las Vegas. Overall, Indian cuisine lags far behind many other ethnic cuisines in the City.  Pure is somehow a 2-3-star restaurant with a 4.5-star rating on Yelp, which is very misleading in my opinion. Many of the curries, which should be more distinctive, are just slight variations of the chicken tikka masala, which is average.  I've had 4-5 of their curries, including the butter chicken, korma and vindaloo, and all were average at best. If I had to pick one, I'd go with the butter chicken.  The quality of their naans and rotis is poor. The samosas were average. The soups were not authentic.   If you eat at Pure, notice that there's an Indian banquet hall in the same shopping center that attracts large numbers of Indian clientele, yet very few Indians eat at Pure. Indians do not like to pay a lot of money for mediocre Indian food, which is unfortunately what you get at Pure.

nD03tFP5-3jQORlfwT8Gfg.text: In a bit of an unusual location on the second floor above Fresh Kabob on Sunset just west of Spencer.  Parking lot is small but there is a parking garage under the building with an elevator to the second floor.  I've only been for lunch but I can say that the buffet is worth the money and shouldn't be missed.  Great to see some good Indian in this part of town!

WX6FeRUu9ybhGzk6Cc5aLA.text: The service is abysmal, they forgot half of our food. Luckily I noticed before I got into my car. I'm still giving it three stars because the quality of the food is amazing.

0F9zQm8yhAVx7IpFrM04Pw.text: In town for a work conference, and after a string of disappointing hotel buffets and sandwiches that looked far better than they tasted, I found this gem of an Indian restaurant. The veggie simosas and lamb curry had me tearing up a tiny bit (spicy), but it was extremely tasty. One of the best I've had. Very friendly and prompt service. Highly recommend this place.

3xW6XxfhmSI4Vf_xawLx2w.text: Rarely do I give 5-star reviews but this place is great! The spices are just right. The flavor is complex and lively. The portions are very reasonable. It's a little pricey compared to what I'm used to paying for Indian food but so worth it. We tried our favorite dishes - chicken tikka masala, butter chicken, palak paneer, and dal tadka. All of them were great. Often dal is watery but there's was perfect. Good consistency and great spice flavor. The chicken tikka masala was probably the best I've had. The tomato flavor shined through without being overpowering. And both palak paneer and butter chicken were above average. The place is hard to find. There isn't clear signage and when you walk in it would be hard to tell it's necessarily a restaurant. The decor is bizarre for any restaurant but the food is so good. Definitely worth a trip out to the airport!

Je-19dVd6hAhGyL-QAUCnQ.text: Mediocre food and horrible service. Even though I love Indiana food and work nearby, today's lunch reminded me of why I don't come here. The lunch buffett is pretty mediocre, nothing really stands out. I don't know if the servers even speak English since they never spoke to me. They also never brought me any bread nor did they refill my water. More like busboys, really. And it being a lunch buffett, their responsibilities were minimal. So no friendly greeting, no inquiries about how I liked my food, no thanks for coming. Nothing. Completely ignored. That's how your HOSPITALITY business FAILS.

E9nxQusfG9NxwUglrgeQ9Q.text: great service and even better food . Nice and warm with great ambiance. highly recommended.

cuNHJCtd6YBkysOZpzJFcw.text: Far from home but one of the few Indian restaurants open late. Worth the drive. I had an amazing first time experience here. Not too familiar with Indian cuisine so we got really great recommendations from our server, Mani and all were just impeccable. I'm not big fan of lamb dishes but the Lamb Korma was just to die for. It had a perfect balance of nutty, sweet, and spicy. The lamb itself was very tender as if the dish was slow cooked for hours. From our appetizer, main dishes and Indian brewed beer, Mani has really set the course of our entire meal and exceeded our expectations. It was also obvious he had a great support team to help him and this restaurant shine.

gwktpCzM3FFUk222343g9A.text: So what was going to be a 1 star review ends up a 5. I called at 1:45am asking if they're open (hours posted say 3am) and they said kitchen closes at 2:30 which is fine I said we will be there shortly. Arrived 2:05 sat down and waiter said kitchen might be closed and I said I was the one that called and he said it's up to the chef. He said they might only be able to do takeout and I said "No" and he came back and said it's all good and we ordered. (He was very polite and friendly during this whole ordeal). We ordered right away we were starving, and food came out 15-20 min later. I was worried they were just going to microwave the food to get us out as fast as possible but nope! Everything made fresh you could tell. The cheese naan is absolutely the best naan I've ever had AMAZING! The eggplant n peas veggie dish off the top flavorful! The butter chicken, tikki masala chicken and shrimp vindaloo were all great and the rice was perfect. Awesome Indian food our favorite so far in town (I have to say we've had better tikki masala chicken other places but theirs is really good too) We will be back!!!!! Cool airport view also I should mention.

L6AdU_ATk_v2wm7pYsxJVg.text: Great view of the Las Vegas International Airport from the large windows on the second floor of the restaurant. Really good mulligatawny soup. Greasy samosas. Service was very slow (5 minutes to even get water when first seated) and waiter seemed rather indifferent and disconnected from the customer. REALLY NOISY: Some young belly dancer ground along to LOUD canned music for awhile. After she finished, another young "multi-instrumentalist" played "live" music with himself and a computer. And then there was the continuous thumping beat from the hookah bar in the adjoining room. I was going to order a main dish, but finally had enough assault on my ears. "Check please..."

6ecszcwf3WRru4wf7Epy4Q.text: This place is great! The service is good the staff is friendly and the food is delicious! Pure India cuisine has live music and is a very quiet nice place to have lunch! The lunch price is average for most other indian food resturants around lunch. It's definitely worth the visit and they also deliver with bitesquad.  HOWEVER, It can be a little bit confusing to find, it's a small door next to the Mediterranean kabob place you have to go up stairs and down the hall a little bit you come to a long hallway and it's at the end pass the hookah lounge.

MZMcbN64A5J3gAv7V_D0KQ.text: Delicious dishes... a tad pricey. Ambience was lovely and there was live music. The servers were attentive and fabulous views.

YDcvVDggfNCcoGVTDPljnA.text: Decided on Indian food today for lunch, all five of us got there at 11:40 and had no wait. I perused the menu and opted for the lunch buffet for $11.99.   They had a wide variety and all the naan bread you can eat :-). I tried the tofu curry, vegetable curry, butter chicken and veggie spring rolls. I also tried some f the sauces with the spring roll. The basmati rice fried rice and white rice was very good. Love to soak up the excess curry with it and dip the garlic naan bread.   The views from this second story restaurant are amazing as it overlooks the airport runways and excellent views of the strip. Could be a great place for a New Years party as you could see the entire show!  The lunch buffet was delicious and I will be back. After looking over the menu I might come for dinner as well so that I could try the chicken or shrimp vindaloo varieties.

9XxFCCl1hTMG1UIPJvKl_g.text: Second time at Pure Indian. something about their curries really draw me to this restaurant. Unique and flavorful. mcN8iKljknpuDmQrdsSUvA.text: I entered a quest to find this place on this day, for a lunch.  The parking garage under the building is the best place to park to access this establishment.  You must take the elevator to the second floor to access properly.  Passing buy the empty hookah lounge, you'll eventually find the restaurant.  View of McCarran airport is what you will see - delightfully interesting!  Finally, I entered and garnered a table.  Service was quick and to the point.  The typical Indian buffet was the offering; however, on second inspection, it was anything but typical.  Selection more traditional and separated via meat vs vegetarian.  They put signs everywhere to describe each item.  For entertainment, they had the baliwood blaring on one TV and an interesting game of cricket on the TV at the bar..  I watched the both.  I would give this one higher stars, but I was served a water in a dirty glass!   The food was tasty enough and well presented.  If not for the water, I would think about 4 stars...anything higher would be disingenuous.

iPaniwmnKhgTC2BFAzWTnw.text: Amazing! We will return often. Every bite we took was a revelation.  Pappadom and chutneys to start. Lasoni Gobi appetizer and Mushroom Masala for an entree. With rice pudding for dessert.  Start to finish it was delicious. We WILL be back.

lBHTojDVj4Hp3iFFKR0VFg.text: Excellent service and Excellent food!!  Definitely place to come for great indian food with excellent service. And best view of airport.

KphhGHIS93h6ATfWWfQGzQ.text: Everything was....on point for one exception  That lentil soup one word....booooooooo It was a few lentils un yellow broth with very very little flavor...too easy to mess this soup But the everything else man was awesome this service on point Want to come back for their brunch or buffet service  Sorry about soup...more lentils and more flavor

n4U4PFtrT9cWFOrE5FsV-Q.text: So glad I came here. The food was very delicious and service was good too. I got hot lamb saag and it was exactly what I was hoping for. The mango lassi was good too. Five starts!

EAojhQMyqCEjT-RjSKq5dA.text: Do not get hooked by the review count and stars they given. I won't judge anyone's taste, but this restaurant is not good at quality ane taste of food. tmzPwA1yAtnskdpHgl1CYg.text: We had 2 nice gentlemen make our food experience delightful. We started with a vegetable samosa. The chutney on the side was sweet and complimented the samosa well. The naan here has a layer of crunchiness on the bottom. The puri bread was soft and i used it as a holder for my entree. The mango chicken surprised me completely because i didn't expect what i was given. I asked for mild since i don't eat spicy food. I was destroyed when i took my first bite of the mango chicken inside by puri bread(made a taco out of it). It was sweet, soft, warm, juicy, heavenly, and at the end a small Ka-Chow(it had some spicy flavors). This is by far the go to dish if you come eat here. The shrimp garlic masala tasted like a garlic baby spicy shrimp from hot and juicy. It was good but not great.

eGHA2rPbEzeEO8oEC2tUjw.text: First time trying Indian food! Got the Chicken Tikka Masala...Garlic Naan...and a yummy Mango drink? Everything was delicious, even the basmati rice! Service was solid. This is like a little hidden gem in LV.  Please check them out!!

s15tTxCLIJ8t7C9fHKx0qA.text: It was our first time to this restaurant.  The location was a bit unexpected to find such a great indian restaurant!  The staff are so friendly, helpful and welcoming!  The food was absolutely fantastic, the sauces had incredible flavor, the dishes were really yummy, especially the lamb biryani!  It's made with so many special ingredients, I'll definitely go back just for that!   :)

7RpCtclVUWjuqYRGOnQTCQ.text: I was excited to try this place as it's got good view and you can see so far out while you eat, food and service were pretty good, their nan bread is just ok, very thick but not much taste, watch out for sharp bones when you have goat curry though.  One thing I wasn't a fan of is their loyalty card, you sign up using your phone, for every 10 meals you get a free one, if you normally eat by yourself it works perfectly, but if you have a family or eat as a couple you are screwed, they required each person to have their own card, so if you bring your husband or wife or friend with you, you can't put everyone in the same card, I feel this is wrong, I been to so many other restaurant with the punch card and they are all under same card, so I feel like it really isn't a deal at all if you eat there with family member, due to this reason I quickly know I won't be coming back as often as I wanted.

k4FTnNjs7jBzIm6Vf9Wrpg.text: The short version:  Food - excellent Service - very good Pricing - reasonable Ambiance - quirky, but pleasant We will be back  The details:  Food: appy - vegetable samosa - well blended ingredients inside and crispy outside - excellent with the brown sauce on the table appy - lasoni gobi - tangy, spicy, and cooked perfectly appy - aloo tikki - the spices in the patties went wonderfully with the chickpeas on the side bread - garlic naan - fresh garlic on naan, enough said bread - cheese naan - gooey cheese in naan, my kid loved it entree - channa masala - spiced perfectly and had a nice texture entree - butter chicken - tender and buttery entree - lamb rogan josh - it melted in my mouth entree - chicken tandoori - the dish was perfectly cooked, which can be a real challenge with tandoori dishes drink - mango lassi - cool, sweet, and smooth drink - sweet lassi - it was ok, i preferred the mango drink - coffee - satisfying dessert - kheer - my little one ate the whole thing and smiled the whole time  Service: we were seated quickly, our drinks and dishes arrived quickly, we were offered excellent suggestions for food, and my water glass was never empty.  Pricing: It was very reasonable for all the food we got. There were 5 of us, we got all the things i listed above, plus a Taj Mahal beer and 2 Sprites, and the total w/tax was just over $120 + tip. Full disclosure, we had a groupon, so we got a few dollars off, but I did not include that in the total for my review. We were all stuffed and 4 of us have plenty of leftovers for lunch tomorrow.  Ambiance: Like I said, quirky, but pleasant. It's set in with a bunch of office/industrial park kinds of places and it's on the 2nd floor (there is an elevator and ramps outside, so it's accessible). The table settings are semi-formal, seats in the booths are comfy, there are colorful lights set into the ceiling by the bar, the walls are full windows, some facing the airport (you can watch planes take off) and some facing the strip (lots of lights, which is fun), a small spot for live music, multiple TVs on and muted (some on Indian channels, some on the hockey game), and it's attached to a hookah bar (totally separate area, so you don't smell the smoke or even see the hookahs from the restaurant - I walked through, though, and it has a very relaxing vibe with another wall of windows - if I smoked a hookah, I would enjoy that space). The musician that they had playing, Miko, sounded great, was very nice, and played jazzy versions of a wide variety of pop type tunes. He didn't take a break for the whole 2 hours we sat there, so I definitely tipped him, too.  The final judgment: We will be back. I enjoyed the experience.

yQvT1EMfv_FmWDbTKePWhQ.text: We absolutely love this place! We come once a week, food never fails to come out amazing!

AVi7crGVrfhBMIoVfZCa9Q.text: Really bad customer service. The manager refused to accept my groupon for the value I paid for (my 2 for 1 offer had expired, and I wasn't asking for them to give me the promotional value, just what I paid for). wD9_cZdrZMnYnnSN1eOolw.text: What an incredible experience we had at Pure. Excellent atmosphere - a great date spot too! The food was delicious and portions were very generous. It's an excellent value given the location, ambiance, quality of food, and service. The place was full but still we got our food piping hot and in time. We ordered chicken karahi, paneer tikka, malai kofta, biryani and naan which was excellent and hearty. We came here on a whim but will definitely be back. Very impressed!!!!

lXBTyEsNroyC0Fw3a-5NTw.text: I would hav said something if it's worth saying. A bad bad hole in the wall with a rude person

NXnuozDJZSKWawBou9yTkg.text: I haven't written a review in a while, but after discovering what is THE BEST Indian food in Las Vegas, I had to speak up.  Pure Indian Cuisine on Sunset is definitely a hidden gem with an amazing view!  Pure is on the second floor of the building, directly above Kabob and across from the McCarran airplane viewing lot on Sunset.  I was taken back to my youth, when my parents would bring us to a restaurant called the Flight Line that also overlooked McCarran's runways...couldn't tell you a thing about their food, but watching the planes come in and out really stuck in my mind.  Pure on the other hand actually made me forget about the planes and focus on the amazing scents of Indian spices wafting through the restaurant and the pleasant anticipation rumbling through my stomach.  Rohani, our server, welcomed us warmly and seated us near the windows overlooking the East/West runway along Sunset.  He started us off with Indian beer, Taj Mahal & Flying Horse, both very tasty lagers and a great way to cool off the curry!  Rohani suggested the Lasoni Gobi as an appetizer (sauteed cauliflower) which didn't sound all that earth shattering, but when it arrived and the munching began, three words came to mind...Ah May Zing!!!  It will be very difficult for us to try another appetizer the next time we go, as we won't want to miss out on this wonderful dish!  We went with Lamb and Chicken curry along with Muteer Paneer and the garlic nan bread.  My nose thought it had died and gone to heaven when every thing arrived!  The presentation was very nice and I can't say enough about how savory and unique the flavors of each dish were.  The lamb was tender and juicy with the curry providing a tasty backdrop with a multitude of flavors that never outperformed the star of the dish.  The chicken curry was also up to the task and I literally had to stop myself from licking the bowl of the Paneer!  The nan bread was crispy on the outside and tender on the inside and bursting with flavor.  Needless to say, we didn't have any left-overs to bring home, which sort of sucks now since writing this has got me seriously jonesing for more!  I see many more trips to Pure in our future.

photos.caption: Photo of Pure Indian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lasoni Gobi
Photo of Pure Indian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb Curry, Muteer Paneer, Chicken Curry &amp; Garlic Nan

NYDPY6DEVh1lj3MSsQnQDg.text: This was my first time trying Indian food.  I read the Yelp reviews and it helped me to select some dishes.  First they brought out some complimentary crispy crackers with two dips.  We ordered some Dal soup and it was really delicious. The Curry Lamb was excellent and we dipped the Naah into the yummy sauce.  The only dish I was not too crazy about was the Chicken Tikka Masala because the  chicken was dry.  The rice was very tasty.  We really enjoyed the meal and will go back soon!

g3p6aoiZ3oS2eurPL5V4Pg.text: Second time stopping by this place and again thoroughly enjoyed the food. They also have a great view of the airport and strip.  Nice atmosphere and pleasant service.

UjKmEDmmud_Tb3qbOjc5bA.text: Just the food alone would be enough to garner my affection. Add in the warm, friendly, attentive service, the excellent view of the airplanes taking off across the street with the backdrop of the world famous Las Vegas Strip, the comfortable modern decor, the TV screens showing Indian music videos, and I am absolutely charmed.  This review is for the $10.99 weekday lunch buffet. They have those classic Indian buffet dishes you expect to see - tandoori chicken, channa masala, saag paneer, etc, but they also intrigued me with a few items I was not already familiar with. I tried the goat curry, as well as a couple of other interesting and tasty dishes that I was unfortunately too lazy to note the names of. The goat was surprisingly tender and delicious. While I personally did not care for the flavor of the curry it was in, my husband greatly enjoyed it.  The other dishes I tried were all superb. Rich, distinctive flavors, and just the right amount of heat. The garlic naan that was brought directly to our table was light and crisp. The rice was fragrant and perfectly cooked.  Dessert round: They had a mango custard dish that was just so lovely. I could have eaten that all day. It had chunks of fruit in it, including papaya, and the custard was so light and refreshing. The Gulab Jamun were scorchingly hot, which, of course, is when they taste the very best, imo. The fresh fruit on the buffet (watermelon, honeydew, and orange slices) was all ripe and sweet.  All in all, a delightful meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Pure Indian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Saag Paneer
Photo of Pure Indian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Butter chicken
Photo of Pure Indian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Goat curry

WL5QgD93YXdv_EhoIRrNbg.text: Thought it was ok. First experience in Las Vegas w/ buffet style Indian cuisine, used to more of a family style.  There was a large family there that kept cutting in and out of the line like it didn't matter at all so it was chaotic, coming up for seconds etc. so that lessened the experience. The food was pretty decent. I would try it again but prefer not to deal with a similar experience in the line for the buffet. The cost was $11.99 + tax so it came to $12.97 for lunch at about 1pm.

n0DfRCorZxvHrCOZsCklYw.text: Food was delicious while we had in our visit. Chicken Tikka in appetizers were the tender and juiciest, as they were served on a hot sizzling pan. Tandoori Chicken could b better, but the masala and cooking level was good. Biryani was not the typical biryani-rather it was a mixed blend of Tomatoes, Onions along with Meat/Seafood. Lots of colors and it tasted like a Spicy curry mixed with steamed rice. Don't order Biryani if you like to have a taste of typical Dum Biryani. Not a good choice. Garlic Naan were fresh and soft. Punjabi Chicken was hot and spicy.  Overall a good place to rely and eat on.

1kMnKko8c-Ggwq0A5gdQNQ.text: Best butter chicken I have ever had! Amazing spices. So happy that I am going to eat here again on my trip. IN my opinion the mild is a great spice level, if you are between spice levels... order down.

VCLh6m1wk9w9uxYN0XzrCw.text: You take the good. You take the bad. You take them both and there you have my mixed impressions of Pure Indian Cuisine. Only the bad isn't really bad. Simply a matter of my expectations being inaccurate.  I found a Groupon offer for Pure Indian Cuisine and saw that my Yelp friends had given it good reviews. So of course I had to try it. My Groupon offer was valued at $30 so I had to get a few items from the menu. Darn the luck. I tend to plan my adventures out so I knew going in what I wanted to try. I diverted from my path slightly.   To start, I was brought the customary papadum and sauces. This was some of the best papadum I've had and the sauces were very herbacious and HOT. Well, not overwhelming but they woke up my taste buds.  On to my order, I knew for sure I wanted to try the homemade Indian tea, vegetable samosas and garlic naan. The tea and samosas came out first. I was expecting a hot tea. This was not hot. Nor was a iced. I suppose tepid is the right word. A tea with cardamom and milk. It was fine just not what I had in mind when I ordered. I was offered a refill but I declined. It wasn't necessary. The samosas were pleasing to the eye. A good size and crisp. Lets not forget hot and fresh too. The potato and pea filling was on the dry side so I spooned some of the leftover papadum sauce onto them. The naan came out with my meal.  For my entree I ordered chicken korma. I changed my mind from chicken jalfrezi which was a departure from the Punjabi chicken I orginally wanted. Either way I was getting something I had not tried before. The korma was a perfect choice. Indian food has such remarkable depth of flavor which is why I love it so very much. This was no exception. The sauce was rich and creamy with a subtle hint of nuttiness from the cashews. It was so soothing. And the chicken was tender. Of course I had to spoon it over the rice which on its own was stellar. Some of the best rice I've had any where regardless of cultural origin. Long grains of seasoned rice that I could make a meal of by itself. Finally the naan. I ordered garlic naan and there was no small amount of garlic on it. It was loaded. The bread thinner than I am used to. And more charred to crispy. Perhaps more authentic than the chewy pizza crust style I usually get. It was different but good in its own right.  At the end of the evening I spent $28 of the $30 voucher I had. Not bad. Plus I brought home some leftovers for lunch. Score. I got to see the planes taking off and landing. And I was called "dah-ling" by my waitress with the ever so slight New York accent. All in all it was pretty good meal that left me full and content.

Mnpj7zbAr4SmSODGvYp68Q.text: The food is good had the Chicken saag. The restaurant is modern and plain with a great view of the airport and strip. The service was slow and the food took over 30 minutes to get.

oeUrgNFPDNkK8VUQs77l3A.text: Love their food perfect spice. Beautiful view of the strip and watch the planes land at McCarron.  Service is timed perfectly. Has full bar as well as buffet daily between 11 and 3.

Vc0s-1br5W_BFdN0iL17FQ.text: I never had indian food before, always thought it was too spicy. My wife choose this place, and i got amazed. The food tastes great, the spices are just right,  amazing customer service, the place is clean as a whistle, amazing view of the airport. I can watch the airliners taking off and landing. It was a great surprise. I definitelly would recomend the place, and im looking forward to coming back and getting to know more of the indian cousine.

KV4ejsNiRgE-iWfRJM5hkA.text: I didn't expect the food to be this good! 10/10 customer service. Would come here again. Good ambiance, and super clean. Would recommend the Chicken Korma.

dX16a8vQaSWgX8n95y_92Q.text: Treated my cousin to a birthday dinner here since we love Indian cuisine and haven't had it in a while. Not a lot of people I know here do. Found this place on Yelp with good reviews and I thought it's a nice location away from the strip. The view of the airport and strip in the background is beautiful, our server Mani was great and the food was delicious. I have a friends from India who have spoiled me with authentic dishes, so I've been dissatisfied with most restaurants I've been to where the dishes are too salty for my taste. Indian food can be, but I don't eat a lot of salty foods. This place seasoned their dishes perfectly. Not greasy or salty.  I ordered the dishes I love for Michelle to try: Navaratan Korma (creamy veggie cashew dish), Palak Paneer (spinach and Indian cheese), dishes came with basmati rice and we ordered two types of naan - garlic and a naturally sweet one (forgot the name) with figs and nuts.    When we were seated, we were immediately served with water, asked for drink order and server returned with a complimentary variety  of chutney and Indian 'crisps' like chips (forgot the name for it!).  Finished off dinner with traditional Masala Chai. It was Michelle's first time trying authentic chai. She loved it as I do.  We were satisfied with our vegetarian dinner. No bloating from salty Indian cuisine is a plus. Will come back again to try their lunch buffet and other menu items!   In addition, they have live dinner music - Mr Montgomery played some smooth jazz reggae fusion that night.  They also have hookah at 7pm in another room.

fh2zOFdrejFibevVbO98rw.text: The BEST decision we've made while on our vacation in Las Vegas!!   The food here is absolutely amazing!! Very delicious! Everything we tried was excellent. Chicken Tika Masala is what I ordered, my fiance had the paneer spinach with chicken Bryani.   The garlic naan was fresh and tasty. We also has spinach and cheese naan (bread stuffed with spinach and melting cheese!   Wow, we were very impressed! The staff was very accommodating, friendly and respectful! Mani was our server and he was excellent! He has great communication skills and very friendly!   We sat in the hookah lounge and ordered a Starbuzz Hookah and enjoyed the view of Vegas strip from afar!   I would recommend my friends and family and anyone to here while in Vegas, the staff is great the food is out of this world good and the atmosphere is romantic and family friendly too as they have two dinning areas!

w7Y9uhKNfDxdTKoWefYCuA.text: My fiance ordered from this place using door dash so I'll only talk about the food since we weren't at the actual place.  We got an order of "lamb rogan josh" which contained lamb chunks cooked with yogurt, onions and spices with basmati rice. We had a choice of choosing the spice for our lamb. We chose mild spiciness and it was a good kick. We also originally chose "chicken tikka naan" but the person preparing our food got our order wrong and gave us regular naan instead. So to go off on the lamb rogan josh, it tasted very delicious and fresh despite it being delivered to us from a 20 minute drive away. There was enough sauce from the meat to drench into our rice, making it perfect to dip our naan bread into.   Overall, the food was great. We would come back to try everything else on the menu.

8ShViuTORKPcucKmHdk5PA.text: Delicious food at very affordable prices. Plenty of vegan options, the staff is pretty knowledgeable about them. It's open late which is always appreciated. And that view! Can't beat it!

BNGp-_s_Xs7orPN6fCG3xw.text: Amazing!!! This is the best place so far to have Indian food. The flavor for curry is absolutely delicious. The paneer is so fresh and soft. The staff is very friendly, awesome service. The mango lassi was too good.  The ambiance  wowww! U see flights taking off and landing every half a minute, unstoppable view of the runway. You can have delicious dinner with fabulous view of STRIP The food quality is so fresh and the best part is they have hookah lounge beside the restaurant so you can have hookah as well as food. The best part is they play cricket on big TV and I'm big fan of cricket. Have a big bar you can sit and have beer which is available on tap, watch football if you are a football fan. I wish i can give more stars to this place! Definitely the best food and highly recommended for your friends. Thank you Pure Indian Cuisine  I'm in love with place.  Manni ( Mangager) is soo nice and friendly. He gave us complimentary gulab jamun for me and my friends.

CNpy39olzd0mabOpcgwILw.text: Delicious food. Well worth a visit. Plenty of flavour and portions are good. A little away from the strip but it was the best decision we made to travel out.  The place looks very clean and trimmed out with good furniture.the staff are friendly and our waitress never let our water get below half the glass.

EAkPPq-Ta1lV9Zq_O5zcKw.text: I did a takeout! Food was ready when we arrived! It was one of the best Indian food we've ever had! We ordered spicy and they were really spicy! We loved it!

Pf-lOdGM8R_IX-qxQgyFug.text: Very close to Vegas Airport, awesome Punjabi food. I tried buffet as well as All carte and was glad I found this place. Best part is its open till late 2 am which I think every restaurant should do in city like Vegas. Just loved it..

9dsfaJeVh9tFwin2Ldv4HQ.text: Great view! And he food was outstanding! We ordered the Lamb Biryani, chicken tikka Marsala, Pilak Paneer and garlic naan! Manny was a fantastic server and helped out with the suggestions. If you like or are curious about Indian food, this place is a must! We will be back!

jsC-7_PJ77sCxUQ_RoqYNQ.text: This food is the real deal. The view of the airport is awesome too! It's super confusing getting up to the restaurant itself, but the interior is very nice and inviting. Large TVs, tons of tables, and even a VIP room. The lunch buffet was incredible, lots of options. I think this place had the best butter chicken I have ever eaten. Great service as well. Will definitely be back soon!

7h_BDpGJih3wJ9skYfNPBw.text: The lunch buffet was amazing.  We showed up at 11:00 and had the place to ourselves.  The food was hot, fresh, and the service was impeccable.  Though a very nice selection, I think I tried almost everything on the buffet.   The goat and butter chicken were my favorites.  The restaurant was on the second floor, which was a little hard to find, but had a great view of the airport.  Having never been there or have looked at a menu, I was extremely impressed how reasonable this place was considering the experience I had.  I would highly recommend them.  My only concern was how few of people were there at a prime lunch time.

P8h7PRj4IjVb3Pad-6Z1yQ.text: The food was delicious definitely going back! The waiter was helpful suggesting a few things that made our experience even better. the only down side is that when you order a soda it's a canned soda which I wouldn't have ordered had I known but that won't stop us from returning.....

EiyjFD7uhQeNjpF4aoVQXQ.text: DO NOT GO HERE TRUSTING THEIR YELP RATING!!!  This is one of those places where you wish Yelp let you put down 0 stars. I had the most horrible food and experience of my life here.  We went in around 9 and they are open till late so it wasn't close to closing time etc. We were in the mood for Indian-Chinese so we ordered the fried rice, veg Manchurian, chili chicken. EVERYTHING TASTED LIKE CRAP, I mean how can someone cook so bad at a restaurant. The Manchurian was so awful that we took a bite and had to spit it out. The food was practically inedible.  We thought that maybe Indian-Chinese is not their strong suit so we ordered a portion of chicken Biryani in an attempt to fill our starving tummies. We sat there waiting for 40 mins for our biryani to arrive. When we asked the server who came in to refill our glasses about the status of our order, upon checking he told us that the guy who took our order FORGOT, he conviniently forgot to convey it to the kitchen so nobody was actually making our Biryani. He said he will fix us the biryani in 15 mins. We had no patience and sadly no more appetite after being in that place for over an hour and 15. While walking out the owner asked us about our experience so we told him that the food was no good and half of the order never came. He told us all sorts of crap about how this restaurant is his passion and he would like "Our People(=Indians)" to go back very happy from his restaurant and what not. My point is if your passion tastes so shitty, maybe you should take up a new passion and hire better people while you are at it.

5b-t3OGMWa9YV8LyesLGwA.text: Service was really bad. For the price they charge, food was strictly ok.i probably aged by  a few years waiting for the food. Stay away and look for something else. Disappointed.

jDa9JUe2zSDc44tQp_cmpw.text: Yay!  After living in Vegas for about a year, I've found my favorite restaurant!   I was craving Indian last night, so after a quick Yelp search, I decided to give Pure Indian Cuisine a try. SO glad I did.  I was alone and went to grab a to-go order, but oh-my-goodness - that view of the strip. If you want to go have a sit down dinner, you HAVE to do it after dark to appreciate what a great view this place offers. Next time I go, I will definitely make time to eat in just to enjoy the scenery. The restaurant itself is nicely and tastefully decorated as well. Whoever I bring there is going to be very impressed, and I'll be the hero.  ;)  Oh yeah, the food.  YUM.  And I'm pretty spoiled having enjoyed great Indian Cuisine from Brick Road in London to Curry Row in NYC, and if what I brought home last night (Coconut Curry Chicken and Saag Paneer) is any indication of what the rest of their menu holds, then color me impressed.  I'm going to have to get back there again soon to find out.... and next time I'll sit and enjoy the view while I dine.

BEsIj-i2T4e3oPKbVtfLug.text: Don't let the location of this little Indian gem fool you. It's across from the airport, in an industrial looking building, up on the second floor. But once inside the ambiance is lively and its fun to watch the planes. When we arrived I was delighted to see All Indian patrons. I love Indian food and seriously - this is the best I've ever had. The lamb biriani melts in your mouth, on a bed of extraordinary rice with cashews and veggies. The butter chicken is so tender i don't know how they did it, with a sauce i could eat every day. Palak paneer, my most favorite dish, was hands down the star of the meal.   Go here and try the good. I'll be back every time I'm in Vegas.

7fYBYVg9OnlrDn5LaiBHWA.text: Perhaps some of  the best Indian cuisine in this city. Excellent service and some  beautiful views. Really great mello music on the weekends. Not fancy and priced really well. Parking can be an issue. If you love Indian food you really should give Pure a try.

mpv2qs3C9Ww0WGO9q8RZiw.text: The food here is very good. However, if you order any type of take out, delivery or pickup, CHECK YOUR ORDER! We have never gotten a correct order from here. I don't know why. Twice we didn't get rice on delivery from Post Mates and had to go to the store to buy it. What's the point of paying Postmates $20 in fees and tips just to have to leave the house anyway? Once on a pickup they left out the rice and an order of curry. Their customer service is non existent. I called to complain, he said "come get rice". Really? If I wanted to drive that far I would have in the first place!

sJlvmIv4lGEBPrjUsowwUQ.text: I placed my order through Yelp/ Grub Hub and waited 55 minutes only to receive the main food minus the rice. I called the restaurant and was told I had to deal with Grub Hub even though I feel it was the restaurants fault since they are the ones that package the food up to go out.  I called GrubHub who called the delivery driver and then The restaurant. The restaurant admitted they didn't send it and would credit me for the missing rice from the 4-5 items. My credit given is $3.24! I guarantee if I ordered 2 sides of rice my total would be more than that. I wouldn't be upset but this is the 2nd time this has happened to me at this establishment and the last time I picked it up myself so it is not a delivery person issue. It is a restaurant issue.  When I spoke with the guy at restaurant he didn't really care.  The  food taste ok which is why I gave 2 stars. I am known to stop and just pick up Naan as a snack for my children at the restaurant but that won't be happening from now on.

Thanks for the takeout order MR. MONEY. I will be back soon to check out the hookah lounge and bar.

Iwn_BFq1Bm8ufzwNIccFIg.text: excellent dishes! my hubby and I was there after work--i got the aloo gobi (vegan) & he got chicken tikka masala (both comes along with balsamic rice) as well as the two helping orders of garlic naan. wonderful and full fillings late dinner meals, they opened really late even after midnight... they have a hookah lounge next to the dining area. both located above the kabob place. can't miss the sign that points you to the stairs. we will be coming here to eat again. I would like to try all their (vegan) dishes... maybe we try to come to their lunch buffet on the weekdays one of those days, their price is a stealer for now, $11.99 from 11am to 3pm. definitely worth eating here.

eGejjcTWDe4wqfckJEdxhw.text: Very mixed feelings with this place. Upon entering on a Saturday night, there was a 1 man band playing which was kewl. We were seated and a few minutes later we were greeted by a slender gentleman and asked if we'd like anything to drink so we gave him our drink order and asked for his recommendations since it was our first time and he said everything is good. So I asked if he's eaten here and he said yes, so I asked what is his favorite and he said everything. Not very helpful at all. So me and my friend asked for more time. As soon as he left, the guy performing leaned over and suggested the Chili Chicken. So the guy came back and we ordered the Vegetable platter, Chili Chicken, Shrimp Tandoori, and Garlic Naan. About 5 minutes later another guy comes by and asked to take our order so we asked him what he recommended and he said the Chicken Tikka Masala so we asked him to change out the shrimp dish for the masala.  He was able to do that. The platter wasn't that bad, it came with various options. The main dishes were another story. Both recommendations were more than satisfying. They were packed with so many flavors that all worked well together. The garlic naan was soo good and if you dipped it into the masala sauce it was more delish.    When it came time to pay, we gave them a gift certificate for $100 but our bill was only $60. They took the gift certificate which was won at an FBI fundraiser and came back and said they can't accept it because someone had wrote in the restaurants info and their GC are different. They claimed anyone could come in and just write it. First it came from the FBI? Second what the restaurant didn't disclose themselves but we found out after some research was that the restaurant changed ownership in the past year. The manager didn't even come out to talk to us and explain. We had to ask the server what the problem was and lastly, it makes us the clientele feel like you're accusing us of scamming the place or lying. So after that interaction, that left a bad taste in my mouth.

DfCCv4S57Fzs5dxFQzQ1_w.text: The owner Raja is absolute present to work with and the food is delicious.  The atmosphere is great.   I often time take my Indian friends after the Grand Canyon and Hoover Dam tour to this fantastic restaurant.  They also provide live singer and band sometimes.   If you have any function like award party, birthday party, etc.. and you love authentic Indian food.   This is the place. :)

02j6qCo_f9MQ_zSkhmPglQ.text: So, my first time here was so bad that me and my date got past the mad stage and just started to laugh. I must have ordered 4 things off the menu and they kept coming back and saying they were out, with 10 to 20 minute breaks inbetween each time. So, after waiting all this time and being out of everything we finally left without having dinner. For this adventure we sat in the Hookah Lounge portion. Thier hookah was terrible as well. Super harsh.  After dropping one of thier managers off while driving for Uber, she talked me into trying them again. The second time my date and I sat in the restaurant section (same waiter as first time). This time amazing service and delic ous food. Thier Naan is my only complaint, tough and boring. One of the best Aloo Gobi I have ever had.   If I had to rate this place on first experience it would be a 1. If I based it on the second experience 4 to a 5 (I love Naan so it disappoints me) So average rating 3. We will see the next time if I adventure into there.

o92ood7R1oWGCH7bOf95qQ.text: Wow! Was craving Indian food, but nothing worth going to late night in the Summerlin area. Luckily found this place on 4 Square, so decided to try it out. First off, the view from the restaurant is wonderful.  Mani was our server. He chose a cauliflower appetizer for us that was simply amazing.  The lamb Korma was pure heaven. Everything was delicious, service wonderful, definitely recommend for late night (and anytime) Indian dining.

vIJPNrqNBkxD-QHzAQHkLw.text: Ya know, when you're from out of town and you just don't know where to go to eat and you decide you really like Indian food so you pick something off Yelp that has a high rating and your pleasantly surprised because maybe you're kind of an Indian food snob and you like your favorite restaurants back home but I've got to say that Pure Indian Cuisine is really good and I would recommend it for all of you out-of-towners who love Indian food and who are visiting from far away.     The Mulagwatawny soup is excellent and hot (temperature) and very peppery. Which is good for pepper water soup... I loved the lamb korma.   My wife had the Paneer with sauteed onions and she liked it as well, so all in all excellent experience highly recommend it.

NtR8PTqrJ1f7bPkHn5nfUw.text: I went here on a date and it was really good. Affordable, tasty, and many vegetarian options.

ZE1RAjcWeBkQfZDJkBhhqw.text: Have been here twice for dinner and the food is always delicious; the servers are cheerful, prompt and always happy to answer questions or make suggestions. We will be back for sure!  The view of the city and the airport is a bonus!

qVLzlKCgRd7LHTq1cyc4kA.text: This is a very nice Indian restaurant to eat. I love the atmosphere and also their delicious food. The person called "MANNY" there is very helpful. I guess he's a manager of the restaurant. They have tremendous service. Amazing view of the airport from inside the restaurant. I really recommend this place if you want delicious Indian food with good atmosphere and excellent service.

H0Q45uLlhFnGIkza7xG72g.text: Extremely slow service. We waited for an hour and half and all we got in that time was appetizers. That's when there were like only 5 other guests.   I'm not sure why they have high ratings. Must be a scam

OzPrRn3sqIREooffN_TcIQ.text: Great atmosphere and food. The restaurant is on the top floor. Fantastic view. Parts are very large, and the food is delicious. The waiter was very friendly and explained the options for eating with a smile. So, if you want to get a great experience, then he is here.

zPxWesmSqLEPXIZ7PbJoWw.text: 5 stars- My husband and I come here at least 2x a month and are addicted! We have never had a bad experience at this place. The food is amazing, service is great and location is ideal. Love this place!

Z7VWppM8AzM8XZc6uz4WzA.text: i live in San jose and was on pleasure trip. i really enjoyed their Buffet . all of the items were top of the line in taste . they have tasty and thick sambher  with idly besides lamb curry and butter chicken all yummy!!!!!. i will defiantly repeat on next trip to vegas

1zB7eu8BMlpnCytywEl0oQ.text: My boyfriend and I came here on vacation. We got a sweet deal on groupon for this place.  We got chicken Tika misalA (however it's spelt) and lamb vindalo (however it's spelt). I enjoyed the chicken, the lamb was mediocre.. the rice serving is small.... we asked for another order of rice, They instead gave us an additional serving of rice on the house.   The view on the second floor overlooks the airport.   I would visit again!  I was going to tip more.. but when I gave them my bill.. they decided to not give back the change?? We waited for it to come back so I could tip them more but when we realize they weren't gonna come back... it turned us off... so we left without tipping them the additional we would have given them.. :/

ZTBVCQGdwSdsZncNOD0bbA.text: My fiance and I went here with a Groupon I purchased. We ordered appetizers, lamb naan, punjabi chicken curry, and lamb with basmati. The food was absolutely delicious! Fresh, hot, and we thought the serving sizes were generous. We left with a very big doggie bag. :-) I left off one star for the service. It was quick and our waitress was very friendly; but she was new and couldn't answer any of our questions. When you don't know anything about Indian food, that's a little frustrating. I'm sure she just needs a little more practice. :-)  Overall, we had an amazing time and will definitely be coming back. The owner (I think he was the owner) was very friendly and welcoming. I can recommend!

bZYrgAcaZP7kXfsOjS_xIA.text: We dined at this restaurant on a weekday. It was not very busy so we secured a prime table next to a window overlooking the runways at McCarran airport. In short order papadum and a cilantro chutney were delivered to the table along with our menus and glasses of water.  Our order included garlic naan, butter chicken, basmati rice and lamb saag.  There was not much protein in either entree and the naan seemed dry, but the saag was above average.  Like many Indian restaurants, the luncheon buffet offers much better value without sacrificing much in the way of quality.

FFaDHv0fsr4UuSikHV8eHg.text: Found a gem of a place right next to the airport with a view of the planes taking off. Apart from the location, the buffet was awesome.The mini samosas and the pakodas should be tried with the mint chutney. The butter chicken and the goat curry were good, the chicken biryani was well cooked and I liked the flavour. They give both plain naan and garlic naan (with no extra charge). I was so much full with the Non vegetarian items that I could not try the vegetarian food. My friend loved the vegetarian dishes though. Overall I loved the food here and the five star is for both the food and the view.

axUVqepGVPBMPhksVwPrAw.text: This is probably one of the worst Indian buffets that I have visited.  The selection of dishes was small.  The Tandoor chicken was dry.  The vegetable dishes were quite oily.  The goat curry was pretty much bones, cartilage or fat.  The dishes that were available were hardly replenished.  I am unsure why this place gets great reviews.  On top of that, they automatically add an 18% gratuity to the bill for mediocre service.

o0oZ3FLt8cvbo6uQUHkRDA.text: I had buffet for lunch, food was tasty but unfortunately not many varieties especially for dessert there was just some pieces of fruit.

6CBdCZNa1erbg3_TdO6LAg.text: Awesome food, awesome service, awesome view at a great price. I was surprised. I'll be coming back!

sM9Q1y2BuAE9sMMnE1KMSQ.text: This is my go to Indian restaurant here in town. They have a decent amount of buffet options and everything is so flavorful and delicious! I think the view is pretty too of the airport. I like how the restaurant has wide windows to look out of while dining. I got a punch card for 10 buffets get one free so I'll try my hardest to make that happen. I would definitely recommend this place if you're having a hard time finding an Indian lunch buffet. Staff is friendly and considerate. Comfy booths. I will be back.

gtMgiPwkzrgdxQrx2Yq0ig.text: This is probably the strangest location we have eaten at in Las Vegas so far. It's on the outskirts of the airport, but it makes for an absolutely beautiful second story view of the Las Vegas Strip AND the airstrip! There's extra parking underneath the building if you are having a hard time finding parking that is not reserved, and the restaurant is on the second floor.  They have a really affordable lunch buffet, check their hours! When we arrived for dinner, there was a live musician playing really pleasant, entrancing music. The place has a good ambiance, and the front of the building is all windowed, so like I said, really great view! Get a window seat and go on a date as the sun sets! We were hungry and in need of a place close by, and we were honestly blown away by how amazing the food was here.  The prices are higher than any Indian food we have had in Las Vegas so far, with an average of $18-20 a dish, but it is well worth it.  Everything, and I mean, everything we had was phenomenal.  We ordered a butter chicken, garlic naan, mango chicken curry, and a mango lassi.  Their tamarind and mint chutneys are absolutely delicious.  Maybe the music was putting us into a trance but this food was.. AWESOME.  At the price point this place is at, I'd say save it for a date night! They also have what seems like (almost, possibly- not confirmed) a full bar.  Their menu has a lot of variety, whatever protein you want is probably there and they cook it so well. You can tell just by the smell in the air when you walk in. The smell of Indian food done right is enough to bring any strong person to their knees.  Do yourself a favor and schedule your next date night here, around sunset, with a seat facing or near the window- it's beautiful and the food will taste just as beautiful.

Okx3ONzlWgGKkehFGv4F6Q.text: Five stars for the food and two, at best, for the service. I do not want to have to flag down the wait staff from talking in a corner because our food was getting cold from not having silverware.   The food was amazing though. We had the garlic naan, Chicken Korma, and Lamb Rohan Josh.

2UNDvwLhUOUkkeWMUwp25w.text: If this were closer to where I live, I'd be there much too often.  Pure Indian Cuisine combines two of my favorite things--good Indian food and a view of planes taking off and landing right across Sunset Road.  I came here with two friends yesterday for the lunch buffet.  The price as mentioned in reviews is $10.99 which includes naan.  After we were seated, we just chatted for awhile catching up on  news (OK, gossip) each one of us had to give.  A young woman from the restaurant came by and told us politely that we could go to the buffet anytime we wanted.  She held off ordering naan for us until she saw us go to the buffet.  One of the first things I chose was the papdi chaat.  This is the first Indian buffet that I remember serving any kind of chaat and it was very good!  I also tried the pakora mix, mutter paneer, and navaratan korma.  Everything was very good.  As we were starting, the server brought our garlic naan and it had a great garlic flavor.  For my second plate, I got some butter chicken and more standard Indian fare.  For dessert. I got a small bowl of mango custard and one of of kheer.  Both were delightful.    Service was very good.  Our water was refilled several times.  I need to go back for dinner and try their regular evening menu.  Oh, yes, and I need to see some more planes.  The restaurant is right across from the Sunset Road parking area for McCarran so it's easy to find.

The view was exceptional, I really enjoyed watching the planes land and lift off. Although shortly after we left I felt sick and stopped mid way home to throw up on the side of the road, then once we got home my poor boyfriend puked as well:(

Talked to grubhub and they called back and said the restaurant would refund the money. Too bad restaurants don't pay enough attention to what is being ordered.

2D7ggTz66Qp0S9qVx31tlg.text: This place is very nice. Great price for good buffet!!! Wine and beer for lunch price on weekends!!' Yesssssssssssssssssssssss

0PSAo9VU6VcKKy_BLmZscQ.text: Food is good. Basic selection. I usually go for buffet, and order a Mango Lassi, with ice. The buffet various. Live music on Sunday brunch, and it's a bit more expensive. I'm new to the area.  Oh, and make sure you take a jacket, it gets very very cold in there. Enjoy!

OaXEMSK0vNLNOQEJ0K0T-A.text: Food at this restaurant is one of the best indian food i ate in US.. the food is really nice with plenty of vegetarian options...we ordered karahi paneer , daal tadka and malai kofta .. all the curries tasted really good with different types of fresh naans complemented the food v nicely.. the place is v close to airport and not very crowded with good quality food.,

I called the restaurant and I was told they never serve naan with Tandoori and it's not their problem DoorDash got the menu wrong. It's not my problem too.

Sz5BaznGO4BsV39c-90mFA.text: Wow, I am still blown away how amazing my food was, Lamb Tika Masala and Garlic bread, washed down with a tasty Taj Mahal beer......I will back over and over again. Mani served us, this is legit.

YClIs33tbTLVIn7OPn9MNA.text: I absolutely love this food. We can get in and out in an hour for lunch because of the buffet.   The butter chicken is amazing and the staff very welcoming.

RsSUsxHNj7rHpzER8pDhkQ.text: I made it in recently for the lunch buffet that is offered on weekdays. I really enjoyed the food and low key atmosphere.  The restaurant is a hidden gem. Even though I work close and have been to the Kabob spot below I had no idea Pure Indian existed. The restaurant was easy to find after reading directions from other reviewers. The restaurant is simple and clean. The dining area is quiet which makes it a nice option for a relaxing lunch.   The lunch buffet is $10.99 which was a great value for the variety and quality of the food. There were plenty of options for carnivores and vegetarians alike. Upon being seated we were offered plain or garlic naan. We ended up trying both and I loved both. The plain might be better if you are using the naan to scoop up sauces. The buffet has all of the fixings for a green salad, several meat entrees, several vegetarian entrees, chutneys, sides, and a dessert option. Everything I tasted was delicious and flavorful. Dishes were clearly labeled to help in choosing favorites.

photos.caption: Photo of Pure Indian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A mix of options from the lunch buffet.

l8WT0U26-U8altZOZhPn8g.text: This is a great Indian restaurant. We order from grub hub. Our food is always hot. They take care in the packaging ensuring no spillage.  That's a plus. After all presentation is still very important in takeout.  Today we ordered Vegetable Samosa, Vegetable Biryani, Garlic Naan, and Dal Tadka.  Yes, yes, YES to everything. I really enjoy the Vegetable Samosa. I usually get two.  This food is clearly prepared with love.  Pure Indian Cuisine is one of my favorite places to order from.  5 Stars

EnuLJioMlUxpGjdBReuwag.text: This was my first time even eating Indian food. I have read some reviews on here and we decided to give it a go. The atmosphere was great. The restaurant was very clean. The location is in a weird spot but it's on a 2nd floor with great views of the strip and the airplanes landing. I ordered the lamb vindaloo, garlic naan bread and a daal. I have to say it was absolutely amazing and would recommend it always now. It will be hard for me to order anything else after having tried that. The wait staff was attentive and very polite. Overall it felt authentic and comfortable. Give this place a try, you shouldn't be disappointed. Loved the experience.

nYK7nb5w_QmYz9WN2-5LSQ.text: This has been a favorite of ours for a while now.  It seems that every time we go they have something new that we've never tried.  Their garlic naan rocks, try it.  Lastly, it's located on the 2nd floor with a view of the airport so it's a extra nice being able to watch the planes come and go.

iSNCBPWaODgZaBidMbEpTg.text: Great service excellent people are warm and polite food is authentic for Indian food. View to die for complements the food.

pL74UycxgGa3FXoLR0IV9A.text: Amazing food with a 5Star costumer service and a magnificent view of the strip and the airport. Our server Prashant was so kind and helpful super professional. We had a blast , go check it out you won't regret it! Our new favorite place.

eb9_xqGfw3td66wO6HuW_A.text: Okay so I've tried a new Indian place every other week here in Las Vegas off and on for about 6 months. Most of them didn't even have buttered chicken or Naan!! This place though, amazing Stuffed Naan with yogurt dip, then the lamb vindaloo was so delicious and spicy( they ask you how hott you want it). I was really amazed how big their menu was so many dishes to try and a really great atmosphere being that this place is on the second floor overlooking the airport. Just for myself I spent about 30 dollars on my meal Naan vindaloo and Taj Mahal beer but they do have a 10 dollar buffet for peeps that don't wanna spend a lot. Bottom line you want some outstanding authentic Indian food without taking a long international flight or dating an Indian girl and service to match GO TO PURE INDIAN CUISINE!!! I will post pictures next visit unfortunately I ate it all too fast okay had lunch and dinner here in the same day dinner butter chicken cheese naan so amazing and served enough for five but I ate it all soooooo good

nAJHcd9x145zbtTZOw8CKA.text: If I were only rating the food, I would give them a 5. The food is wonderful and so flavorful. This is not the first time we've been here and the food has always been excellent. We ate there this evening though and the service was horrible. Our waitress was non existent. She never came back after taking our order. A gentlman (not our waitress) brought the food and another gentlman brought our check after we sat for a while. Nobody checked in with us to see how our meal was. The restaurant was not busy at the time (only a couple other tables) so there was no excuse for such terrible service. Our bill was $4.33 after a $30 Groupon. We left a $5 bill and got the heck out of there. There was nobody around to complain to about the service. I hope the restaurant reads this in order to understand why we essentially "stiffed" our server (what server?). Perhaps it was an off night. Again though, the food is wonderful.

tgiumOIqevNiS4_3vS5A1w.text: The food is delicious!! Always a great atmosphere, friendly people, lots of fun and great music. Sometimes, there's even a belly dancer. Plus, the view is great, you can see the Strip!

fY9yxWgump9AnI6RofwpSw.text: Definitely not that good. The naan is terrible. It's thick and doughy and no butter on top. Disappointed that they didn't have dahl. Will continue going to Origin of India.

ASHRLoDTkrOT6Z1Ldpvq4A.text: My mom and I tried this place after she picked me up from the airport. The ambiance was very modern/chic (great date night spot), the service was excellent (shout out to our server manny) and the food was superb.   I highly recommend this place!

iBXcTGy3SkuH0BmaakLpPg.text: Wonderful lunch.  Had gotten a groupon and decided to check it out.  They have an awesome buffet that gave me the opportunity to try many dishes I normally wouldn't have tried.  YUM!!!!!!  Naan bread is served with the buffet and you have a choice of regular or garlic.  Service is excellent. Servers come frequently to make sure that everything is fine, but not to be intrusive.  The restaurant is located across from McCarran Airport and you can watch planes taking off and landing which is also fun.  Aside from the buffet they also have a full menu which I also took advantage of getting Tandoori chicken to go for my dinner.  If you like Indian food....check it out.  I'm going back.

CIaVsnP5gYl3ZWstHdx3Hw.text: Amazing food and atmosphere . Great service and just killer food. Samosas, garlic Naan, chicken tikka masala , mango llasi! I was in heaven . It's weird placement of the restaurant , you take the stairs or elevator up to second floor and you are here. I would come back in a hot second !
