smsIT9Shm2szBLwjm2VTlQ.text: The low down  Location: easy to get to on Sunset Rd about 5 minutes east of the Strip. The restaurant is on the 2nd floor over looking the McCarran runway. Kind of cool of cool to watch the planes take off and land. As the sun goes down you can get a decent view of the strip. Their signs aren't the most prominent so being able to notice it while driving by may be a little hard. They are directly above a Kabob restaurant.  Ambiance: very clean and and nice looking. kind of open with a lot of windows. We ate there for dinner an got there before sunset. They had shades pulled down on the west side to keep the sun out of our eyes. The only drawback as it started to get dark outside was their light. Although there isn't much they can do without spending a ton of money but they utilized the fluorescent lighting in the ceiling. Most of the fixtures were covered with blue panels but there were a few that weren't. One being right above out table. Which turned out to be bright and obnoxious. They might want to use a warmer type of lighting. There was a man with a keyboard playing live music which was quite pleasant. I'm not sure how often he is there.   Food: we ordered Chicken Saag, Chicken vindaloo , garlic naan and rice. The Naan had a great flavor and slightly thicker than normal. The Vindaloo was awesome. I think I might have ordered it a little too spicy but I was able to handle it. The Saag was the best that both me and my girlfriend had ever had. The naan seemed to be very pillowy and fresh. All in all. Extremely good food.  Update: we went back a few days later because we wanted to try the buffet. All items that I tried were delicious. Especially the Butter Chicken and Palak Paneer. The chicken tandoori was slightly on the dry side but flavor was very good. And there were other delicious items that I don't remember the names.

UF-rBGu9GU2xuKS8MQdCpg.text: This place was a huge disappointment. The food was mediocre. Not a huge selection for lunch and the tandoori chicken was dry. Had to keep asking for bread and refills on drinks. That's a pet peeve of mine, with good service you shouldn't have to ask especially since the gratuity is automatically charged.

89I5fM3cYtP_QNvpuVoGaA.text: After 2 days of tiring activities in Vegas.. we were looking for some good Indian food and found this place on Yelp.. which eventually was the only Indian restaurant open after 11pm. The place is next to Airstrip.. and to my surprise turned out to be the best Indian food I had in Vegas yet.  This place is great for both Vegetarians and Non Vegetarians.. I would like to come again n again here..  Nice people and great staff..   And yeah.. they have a hookah joint too.. so you could plan something extra with the food...  A great place to eat

aL_o6Ex-vpL-Dir-cVbEfQ.text: I went to Pure Indian Cuisine for dinner last night and had some of the best Indian food I've ever had! The view is amazing, Mani provided great service and the food is to die for. I'll definitely be back! :)

zxu5wQBUDHZ6mV4Dc0KMXw.text: Beautiful views, open and spacious. You must try their Salted lassi and masala tea. There isn't much else though. We ordered samosa chat, Lasuni Gobi, Rotis, Paneer Tikka Masala, Butter Chicken, Dal Makhni and none of it was good. Lasuni Gobi was limp and soggy, Samosa Chat was spiked with too much Garam Masala and the dal was watery and without flavor and I dont have much to say about the Paneer and Chicken.   I do have to say we received excellent service. The waitress who was serving us was polite, friendly and attentive. When she noticed the leftovers and food on our plates she got worried and asked after it. She also requested that we dont give a negative feedback on Yelp. If the owner's reading this, you know you have a keeper in her. And to the lady herself, sorry but I have to do this. I bank on the ratings I see on Yelp and have to be honest to my peers here.

3lYTxq4Pk9w0e2QewNAkUQ.text: Oh so delicious! Rich, complex, subtle, colorful Indian flavors. YUMMM.  And such wonderful, cheerful, gracious service from Nikita. Everything she recommended was spot on great.  The one criticism I have is that it's a little hard to locate, being on the second floor, next to a hookah lounge, and the signage could be much clearer.  But once we arrived it was wonderful all the way.  The menu is a little overwhelming with so many delicious choices. [Nice problem to have!] I literally could eat here 3 times a week for 6 months and never have the same thing.   I ended up getting the spinach paneer and a lamb curry. Wifey, a picky  vegetarian, got something just as delicious. And she was able to enjoy the paneer, too. I'm carnivorrific, but I could eat Indian  vegetarian forever and be happy.  And THE VIEW! It's really cool being across from the airport on the second floor. I couldn't stop watching the big ol' jet airliners landing and taking off.  Even the ToGo containers are the best, those little Tupperware bins that won't leak on the way home and can be used again and again.  Go to this place!!!! It's great!

wLN2TnuCP6ZYA-yuXpT6Ng.text: Excellent food! I had the Chicken Korma and it was delicious! Best Indian restaurant that I've ate at in a long time. Service was great. The restaurant sits across from the airport with a view of the Las Vegas strip.

Zsu5MshYTR5VXCocOJYYBQ.text: Food was amazing. My husband and I started with the Tandoori Fish appetizer. The fish was fluffy and flavorful. It didn't need any sauce, it was awesome by itself. We then ordered Lamb tikka masala(lamb curry), Chicken tikka masala(chicken curry), with Garlic naan(separately). The portions looked small, but it filled us up just right. The food was so amazing we had to end our course with dinner. We ordered the Gulab Jamun (mini donut holes soaked with glaze) and it was amazing. They only give you two donuts, I wished they served more because it was so delicious. We are definitely coming back to show our friends and family.

uRO2KEeroH9ta1UsGuYrmQ.text: I don't normally like Indian food but this place tastes awesome! The interior of this place had really nice metallic colored wooden floors and the views are a 360 view of the strip as well as the airport.  This is the perfect place to have brunch in the afternoon and a lounge drink at night. The owner, Raj has such great hospitality and they also have live music that was relaxing to my ears.   The Indian spice level for the buffet is perfect but the dessert "gulab jamun" was too sweet for my taste. It's a fried dough ball sugared with sugar syrup!   I would love to come back again.

3ynoyy-cxq6B3k8K6amJbg.text: Went for lunch buffet. The food was lukewarm and there was mostly sauce with a little meat in the buffet trays. Service was mediocre to non-existent. Best item was the chutney.

UGiupOA0_XLbYodJBxmvLA.text: So I'm a Brit living in Vegas, I've eaten everywhere from Mint (Good but not legendary) to Turmeric (Too spicy and trying to hard) this place wins my favorite Indian in town.   Great presentation, amazing flavors, chicken. Poked to perfection. I'm officially impressed!

pl2BBuJLEQrUfnsnJV92Bg.text: We order food here quite often because it is the closest Indian restaurant to our house. We sometimes eat at the restaurant or order ahead for pickup, or online. The restaurant has a great view, quick service and friendly staff. The prices are reasonable for their food and drinks. They have a live performer there usually on the weekends. I like the overall ambiance of the restaurant. We can always count on getting seated right away when we go. And they are open late which is convenient.  Regular orders are: garlic naan bread and vegetarian tikka masala.  4 stars because we have had a few experiences when we order for delivery where the garlic naan bread was burnt and the tikka masala was too oily.

a8juHfSq_Etkl-TH8UtiMw.text: One of the worst Indian restraints I've been to.   We ordered off the menu and did not eat the buffet in hopes of fresher food.   The garlic naan was burnt. The center had been rolled out to thin and was charred to a crisp. No garlic flavor.   The chicken dish we ordered was wrong and had to be sent back. The redo was just as bad.   The vegetable curry was mostly  frozen vegetables tossed in with some fresh bell peppers and onions in a nondescript yellow sauce they called curry.    The basmati rice was over cooked and dry. Normally you get light fluffy long fragrant grains.  We got the opposite. Small broken grains of poor quality overlooked dry rice.   Service was poor. There is no organization. We had three different people trying to take out order which would sound like s good thing. But when you ask one person a question or dietary requests and someone else takes your order it leads to mistakes.   Location: was this an office space before? There is no real entrance to this restaurant. Just a series of hallways and if you figure out the maze you get rewarded with poor quality food.

UIX19xVmuUiUf4f6J5JvRw.text: Another wonderful Malai Kofta!!!  I love this place and the food is awesome!   Come see Mani and give him a hard time about everything.  He loves it!  Enjoy the food and relaxing music by Montgomery

trhBovtEmwblE8d966IidA.text: What a surprise!!! I really enjoyed having dinner here. From the moment I walked in, it was evident that the owners/managers pay close attention to detail. The resturant is impeccably clean!  The ambiance was very inviting. Very nice view of the strip and tarmac of the airport was good. The servers were very nice, attentive and professional.  Nikita was SUPER NICE!!! Very genuine and knowledgable about the menu.   The food was REALLY good. The "naan" bread was amazing  unfortunately, I can't pronounce what the hell I I ordered. Sorry....you won't be disappointed. Give this place a try. Also, there's a pretty good deal on groupon to save a few bucks.

ZuEqS5D-rgmbM-S1-orF5Q.text: I went to Vegas over the long weekend and was looking for the Indian restaurants which open late and found this one. When we went there it was a surprise and we found Hookah bar there . There is a cool belly dancer too who is dancing on Bollywood music. It was great fun with hookah, belly dancer and enjoying Indian food. Four best parts 1) Best food, its fresh and north Indian 2) service is best, all the waiters, manager and hookah waiter are all down to earth and fast in action and to the point. 3) stunning view, you can see Vegas airport from window and see flights landing. 4) Hookah +Belly dancer +Bollywood  I would definitely recommend this place and you will have best time.

dUWhdLbz4FFPPJ1psSR3kw.text: I ordered from this place yesterday through grub hub and I accidentally ordered the same thing twice. I called the restaurant directly to correct it. They advised me to cancel my order and re-order it because the item I wanted to swap for was more expensive. I couldn't figure out how to do it and they were kind enough to just swap the item for me free of charge. Great customer service, great food, so happy with them!

loQQi3yzM-FsSZWlcPAVIQ.text: The food is amazing. We don't do buffets so ordered off the menu. We had chicken tikka, chicken tikka masala and the butter chicken. We also had a few appetizers. All ordered mild as we're wimps, but the food was excellent. The only odd part of this place is the hostess/server (she provides water, menus, etc) had water in hand, had given us water glasses but still took a good 5 minutes to get water. It was bizarre because she came to the table with the water pitcher, walked away with it, walked around the restaurant with it (filling others' glasses) and finally got to us again. We've been here twice and twice the same server/same issue. Otherwise it's a 5 star place!

wbPE-mqCaj5u5MIK6S-d0A.text: Worst Indian food. I will never go or suggest anyone.  It's not even eligible for one star but yelp mandates it.   1. Food was cold and didn't look or taste fresh. Not sure when they prepared   2. They gave rice and we saw hair in the rice   3. When I told them food was bad, manager didn't even apologized  and he charged full bill.   Worst food and worst customer service.

WbmUOhCInZMPHjmFznoOBA.text: My boyfriend and I are visiting and happened to stumble upon this restaurant. We were incredibly impressed by their service and phenomenal authentic food. What a wonderful experience we had and would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for good food and a solid environment.

hdkGtnSpHtW5_YXOybOf5A.text: The food was beyond excellent, the service was top of the line! If we could give this place a 10 we would. We will be back, a rare find for sure.

WKpnN3SecwKyynK2v4gB8A.text: Late service and even the worse food. Definitely not recommend this place for people who are looking for authentic Indian food in Vegas. You will end up wasting your money and time.

i_Uvo0uI2aFkAgSbJzKCiw.text: Officially our newest favorite Indian food in Vegas. We own a vacation home in Las Vegas and have tried pretty much every Indian in town. India Palace was our favorite but once we tried Pure, it's our new go too. The most crispy and filled pakoras, the chicken tikka was tensor and well spiced, the mutter paneer was perfect consistency and the flavor was perfect  Keep it up Manny!

u5ExTHrIdVeObexWHYO9bQ.text: Exceptionalland extremly tasty food. Loved the Buffet and the view of the strip from there was also really amazing!

WIJL_yew6eb_xD6vOF3KgA.text: This Indian restaurant is off the beaten path of the strip. You could miss it driving by its on the second floor of a office building over looking the LAS runway. Really cool setting!. Everything here is made to offer you can't go wrong. The food was amazing, we had the: chicken tikka masala, lamb biyani, and chicken vindaloo all were amazing, perfect blend of spices. Don't forget the garlic naan and dessert. Thanks for a great date night!!

NBeK-BpUEAQp0xAa0FT99Q.text: What a little gem of a restaurant, with a gorgeous view of the airport and the strip in the back ground. Food was seriously delicious and well worth the price. Friendly and very attentive.

XwS23sMcg5rL-NsTNzVVeg.text: This was my second time coming and I honestly won't go to any other Indian place regularly. This food is so good and prefect for a quick fix! Loved it the first time, and love it again. Will keep coming here! While here, try their paneer pakora and fish pakora for appetizer. The paneer tikka Masala and butter chicken are awesome!!

OO_TVmiiZSEF2psJbKbTAw.text: Butter chicken is great. Service is amazing, especially Mani who is very welcoming and attentive. Beautiful views next to the airport and good hookas. Will definitely come back the next time I visit

Mu5BJ16ik6brNbBnjpQh0w.text: Excellent flavorful food and superb service by Mani. This place is a very clean establishment with beautiful city views. I can't wait to return! :-)

RxPuHQhmPZXkGSj_U6wpNg.text: The food here is very authentic. Flavors are great. This place has a great atmosphere. Will definitely be back. . .

kL74guReElGt2n1Rmz01IQ.text: Food didn't taste right and the waiter was so rude about everything. I came for dinner before and that was amazing but the buffet wasn't good. Not sure what happened. I would definitely come back for dinner, but after the very rude experience with the waiter, I won't be coming back.

n8z4OQgY1yiP4MZzwFvjGQ.text: Wow, what an authentic Indian Food experience. Mani and Natalia provided amazing service and went above and beyond when we made a mistake ordering. There was live music that set a really great mood as well. Highly recommended!

UJAL0vCltPPnb6c6YXzjMQ.text: Amazing food.  Great view.  Delicious yet not heavy.  A must repeat often experience.  Please don't tell too many friends as I don't want it to get too crowded.

PPc2hVhpxttVdy31lfmR7g.text: I had the chicken korma and it was the best I ever had. Delicious!!!! The ordered the bread cooked with lamb inside. Also some appetizers of vegetables that were excellent.. I am so glad to have found this spot. Beautiful view of airport and live music. I love the Indian beer also

GOzrKmeyInhSLGuAUZtDhw.text: Excellent food. Reasonably priced. Wonderful courteous service. Comfortable ambience. Excellent view. Very highly recommended !!!!

W4ShXkC0Q5LyOu1o2okHxg.text: I love a good Indian buffet! Rarely do I have the appetite or time for a buffet, but I'm glad I was able to stop by this one. I arrived about 30 min til they were closing, but I was still able to enjoy plenty of food.   The highlights I enjoyed were the creamy chicken tikka and the samosas. The tikka masala was so flavorful and pretty much made the lunch. The samosas weren't overly greasy, which is usually a problem for me. I also loved the fresh hot garlic naan the waiter brought out to my table.   One of the best things about this spot is the view of the airport. It's so relaxing to watch the planes go by.   I was probably expecting a few more vegetarian options, but I will have to come back for a full meal and try some vegetarian bites next time.

dvS1Z9ZKEllkj25Nuo0jwQ.text: Best Indian food, I'm not just saying that. So yum! We always start w the veggie samosas. I always tell myself that I will try something new but I ALWAYS end up with the chicken tikka masala. Can't forget the garlic naan!! If you're in the mood for something to cool you down while also being delicious get the mango lassi, oh...my...gosh! The staff is very very friendly and attentive. Great view of the airport landing strip.. nice vibe!

Ykn0fA-Wagnw0qJ7KBtf3A.text: As soon as I walked in the gentleman at the front, Adrian, was very nice. I wanted to order takeout and he still offered me a seat and a glass of water. I had questions regarding the menu items, which he also took the time to help me with. Being that it's 1:30am and slow (about 6 others here) I think that he working as the host and the server right now. But after helping with my decision he took my order, I ordered spicy basmati fried rice w/ chicken (I can't remember the name of it lol) It was wrapped up very nicely for me when he brought it out and it looked delicious. The flavor was awesome! It was definitely spicy and had big pieces of chicken. I'll definitely be back to experience the full restaurant experience.  Ok. I'm back. Im gon leave that up there  because that's how it started. This is my edit a few bites later...  My mouth on FIYYAA (fire)  I had a choice between mild, medium and spicy. I chose spicy  When Adrian said "are you sure?" That was my que to run   I love spicy food. Jerk chicken, spicy curry, etc. But this is a whole nother level of 'stupid spicy', that's what they should call it, Stupid Spicy. I'm still eating it though. But man it's a struggle. My nose, forehead and even the top of my head is sweating, my sinuses have fully cleared up  and my tongue is on FIYYYAA. But it's still good. I'm just going to have to put the rest up and try again tomorrow  Maybe I ate a seed or something

o2DCj-JuAcLHayuJqxEnpQ.text: Not going to lie, this time we did not enjoy this place. I have been here twice before and both times the food and experience was better, now understand that it is a weird location and bot very warm or welcoming. This time the food was dull and uninteresting, me and my wife did not finish out plates, the only reason for 2 stars is because of how apologetic the staff was when we told them.  We wont be back.

19M96dL0_Up6-tr4wchefA.text: Yummy! I can't believe this place has been so close to both my house and work for so long and I haven't been here. My boyfriend was craving Indian and he found a groupon. Saw that the reviews were pretty good so we decided to check it out.  First, the place is super clean and has an amazing view of both the airport as well as the strip. We are already talking about coming back and timing it to catch the sunset.   The service we had was impeccable! Everyone was great but especially our server Mani who was incredibly attentive to our needs throughout dinner. Very friendly and helpful!  We started with some drinks and samosas. Then we moved on to some tikka masala, vindaloo and garlic naan. Everything was excellent and nice portions which is important to me since I love leftovers!  Prices were very reasonable but an even better deal if you can still score the groupon. Looking forward to coming again soon!to coming

tDgUYxKRkf2YIY5KmDUkKA.text: Great service. As good as Indian food you'll find in Vegas. Bit of a drive out or a non-trivial Uber. You sit in the car thinking "there cannot possibly be an Indian restaurant out here" ... but you are wrong! There is, and its a good one. Worth the time to drive out to.  Its peaceful too and you can see a great view of the strip out the window on the horizon.  Ate here twice in one week of visiting Vegas. Was consistently good both times. Staff super friendly and open to meal customizations and explanations.  Definitely will visit again if I find myself staying near the strip again.

H5P-oD0Fh52HT1AHGg_Ojg.text: Great service and courteous staff is the only saving grace. Food is mediocre at best. Another classic example of being fooled by high yelp rating. Zero stars for

BQWN1P_ngJrp7Tn7QKJuIQ.text: Came for dinner. Terrible service, place is empty and I couldn't buy a refill on my glass of water to save my life.  Ordered the lamb tikka masala at the waiter's suggestion, and a chili chicken dish.  The lamb tikka masala was acceptably flavored but not striking in any way, and there may have been 3oz of meat in the $19 dish.  The chili chicken dish had plenty of chicken, but was pretty lackluster.  All in all, I'd rather have grabbed a burger at literally anywhere that I drove past on my way over here.  A huge let down, given the quantity of 5 star reviews.

5VKwzYV6SDirVP-9S4zSiA.text: So amazing! If you are craving authentic Indian food. You better get your butt over here!   The lamb kofta was tender so flavorful and the garlic naan is so fresh. On top of it all the views are spectacular!

IsYNwLNl90l663D4XQDQ8Q.text: After touring Las Vegas, Mt. Zion national park and Antelope Canyon for around 5 days we really were starving and craving for Indian food. This place was a perfect one to quench our thirst. Enjoyed the buffet lunch on our way to LA. Food taste was good. Wonderful place to eat Indian buffet if you are in LV.

cKzHB9ZhAFA6XMWkuhQnuQ.text: Never really had Indian food nor knew where to go.  But this one is going down in the books. Wish I could of dined in but got my food to go. After driving 14 mins to get home and then waiting another 20mins to eat the food it was still hot and fresh( no microwave was needed). The server over the phone suggested some great items !!! And the flavor and spices are to die for. Will fersure be returning.

Eventually after my 3rd time calling back, I was able to get the total. They advised the food would be ready in 20 minutes. Well it's now 1 hour 30 minutes and the food is still not ready. The chef comes out saying that there's a s**** show going on in the kitchen in Spanish.  My sister who is picking up the order is waiting at the bar and so far no luck. I tried calling to see if we can cancel the order. They aren't answering the phone anymore. What the heck is going on?

ZX-H5H1zWebnhLfmMIYqIQ.text: Very delicious. Buffet was good. Service was great. I felt very welcome there. Nice to watch the planes come in and out. I chose this place over another at the last minutes for me and my girlfriend's anniversary and it did not disappoint.

yqsubRHSMwbRN_49lPQhTw.text: I love eating here!!! They have a great lunch buffet and equally great full dinner service. The food is fresh and full of flavor! The mango lassi is also delicious! Best in Vegas! Vegetarian dishes as well as meat dishes! All are delicious!

qxgpwbx9mx9bdXVR2l51Vw.text: Our return visit after the last one which was superb as seen in my previous review. Not very happy this time. Curries were meh, not authentically Punjabi as what I remember from last time, appetizers were kinda hard like they have been sitting for a while(we arrived at 12), naan was the best item. Taste of the food wasn't upto the mark, desserts only kheer which was okay. Our server was nice. We took a uber ride to come off the strip. Not doing it next time we come. It unfortunately has become like other Indian restaurants. Disappointed.

Xxdz8jk3bmiRL_vL5HKQ-g.text: Very tasty food, and amazing to get a nice meal like this at 1am!!  Had the basics butter/vindaloo/korma and they were all tasty.  Will absolutely try a few of their other dishes and try the buffet during a lunchtime.  Ordered medium and they were are very tame on the heat, so I will go hot next time.

RfE6GE_ez-rPgpZF2pmEFA.text: In Los Angeles we have very very GOOD INDIAN FOOD!! I do have to say LA has some competition!! Food and Service is Excellent!! Our Server Mani was great!!

5aKSge-V8WXUUENN7zjYyw.text: I just finished what may be the best Indian restaurant meal I've had anywhere. Too bad I'm only visiting because this would be a regular spot for me. But rest assured the next time I'm in Vegas I'll be back!!!

Y3OEN-oLv5FlJbI1NmSt4w.text: It bums me out to have to leave a negative review for Pure because I really wanted to like it. I was feeling lazy and didn't want to cook Indian food so we ordered some to go. We got palak paneer, chana masala, and chicken curry. The food was so-so. Worst of all, we ordered roti with our food. They gave us 4 pieces for $12. That's freaking absurd. I make roti at home and that costs me maybe 50 cents for a DOZEN full rotis. They cut one roti into 4 pieces and charge freaking $12!! Ridiculous. When we contacted them to tell them we were missing roti, they told us they would give us a credit- but took no name, number or order reference. Buyer Beware! There are MUCH MUCH better places for Indian food. The Kabob place downstairs from the Pure is a great deal with much better tasting food. I'm sorry, but I can't say under any circumstance will I every be going back.

EGaVd138jc9_MYH4U-Fq8w.text: Solid Indian food. Top ten lunch buffet in Las Vegas.  I've eaten Indian food in North America, Africa, Europe, and Asia (four different continents).  While I've had better (and more expensive) Indian cuisine, Pure Indian punches above it's weight. I'm disappointed by reviewers complaining about the food selection. The lunch buffet features all the staple dishes, pakodas, rice, tandoori chicken, daal or lentil soup, vegetable masala, crisp garlic naan, etc.   I've been hosted by several Indian families over the years. Dishes like chicken tikka masala are put out to appease an American palette. I stick to the core menu. It's delicious and satisfying. I could easily eat here everyday without getting bored.  The panoramic views of the airport are a bonus. I come here for the food.

NpByiobBMfNIyX7ybcz95Q.text: My first time to ever have Indian food and this was amazing! Sits right in front of the airport with huge windows to watch the planes and a great view of the strip! My son is a local and took us here and I just can't get over how flavorful the food is and the enjoyable atmosphere and the service was excellent! This will be a place I will defiantly come to when we visit Vegas!

eNJpol0pEeAp8olX9qSvwg.text: Pretty good Indian restaurant. I've only been to the buffet, but the selection is great. Loved the sag paneer, tiki masala and curry chicken as well as the vegetarian dishes. Nice view of the airport runway where you can view the planes landing and taking off.

IYvkVwmgKFCxWLi8tDgD7w.text: Groupon!! $30 off two people  Live Music Great Spicy Food Hookah (if you're into that) Fantastic View of planes landing and of the Strip at 10pm  I ordered the Lamb Biryani with Garlic Naan and he ordered chicken something that was extremely hot.  He told them he wanted it "Hot" and that was exactly what he got.  I stayed away from it.  The drinks were not great, though.

aJMLy92uhpSHmbcjhX9jPA.text: Delicious for dinner buffet was not great I have been here numerous times but only twice for lunch buffet and I don't think I will give it a third.  We showed up at 12, in my opinion what should be height of lunch, and expected the freshest hottest food, sadly we were disappointed. The food was good amazingly flavorful and everything, but it was not hot, not cold either just warm. The tandoori chicken was dry as though it was reheated from the day before. I also didn't care for the lamb. Being that I'm not completely familiar with all Indian food I rely on the labels. There were some, but not enough and asking the staff didn't help because the person I got was less then capable of communicating clearly.  All that being said I have gone for dinner and had hot delicious amazing food. The chili chicken is wonderful. As well as paneer tiki masala and samosa chaat, vegetable pakor. I didn't care for their bhurtha bharta but it wasn't bad.  have so many things I still want to try!!

cSM-4RmBj7vr9ZRXzVyGRQ.text: This is my favorite Indian restaurant in Vegas!! I'm so happy my friend brought me, I simply can not get enough. Highly recommend it!  Kristine

kNwyEynkTO2-KY_zM0I90Q.text: So I have come here several times after my first wonderful experience hoping it would take me back to that very satisfying time.   Sadly I feel while the food is not bad by any means,  the evolved flavor profiles have been lost while the amount of salt has increased.   In addition some items were just bad,  like the veggie pakora  was more chewy and dense than crispy.   It's a shame, and I hope they make the changes needed to have the same quality they offered when first opening.

Nqf4TZMWKss1zTeebyC4Ug.text: I have been to Pure Indian many times since I first reviewed it several years ago.  I must say that I have never been disappointed and tonight's meal was no exception.  We had butter chicken, palak paneer and lamb josh rogan.  All were gourmet level, savory and delicious.  The garlic nan just melted in our mouths!   In addition to the exciting views of the Strip and the McCarran landing runway, they have also added a musician on the weekend playing soothing, dinner conversation-appropriate, contemporary tunes.  Service was excellent and the management very caring.  Mani is best.If you haven't tried Pure India, you're not enjoying the best in Las Vegas Indian cuisine!

xUY-d45bGAK05ouDGruUxQ.text: Nice food. I came here first time. They had lunch and menu as well. I decided to have buffet. Oh man each and every dish has his own taste. The best buffet. Try it guys

4KsWGvd-9UJNSOphVN4T5w.text: If you are near the Vegas airport and in mood for an Indian bite before or after your flight this place will not disappoint. Their lunch buffet though is a much better deal. Food is better than your average Indian fare, but not outstanding.

csiandJhRYqYliaSF4LdBQ.text: Randomly stumbled upon this place and was VERY happy with what we discovered. The food here is great and the service was awesome!! I very much recommend to anyone looking for a good Indian restaurant!! I will be coming back ALOT!!

5u4jyFd6PzNpxoRqOPkFfw.text: The absolute best Indian food anywhere!!  We're in Las Vegas for meetings and crave Indian food. A local recommended Pure Indian and it is the best Indian food we've had since London!!  We travel all over the world and food is one of the highlights and for Indian food, there's no need to go far with Pure Indian.  If you love flavorful foods and the best quality, I highly recommend that you try them out.  They have a lunch buffet and weekend brunch.  The service is impeccable, everyone is so nice. It's family owned and they love to chat.  I have been here twice and wished they were in Ca. Until then it's my go-to restaurant.

1an89nYGC56Rw-xjKMOm4w.text: First time here and we love Indian food. New to Vegas and didn't know where to go. Found a Groupon so we thought we'd try it. The food is amazing. Authentic. Really good. Great view of planes taking off at the airport. Not a ton of ambiance but the great food makes up for that.

k0pdW6n4LXP5X0riCjAZ4Q.text: The food is excellent. I enjoy the taste and quality of the food. There is a also a good view of Las Vegas and the airport.

stTyU6cnavPegQLNui3yWg.text: The service was attentive, the food was tasty, and the entertainment was enjoyable.     We had samosas, chicken korma, chicken tikka, and naan; everything was beautifully spiced.  Also -- as other reviewers have noted -- the location (next to the airport runways) is prime!

3cPI5Z9L6CNY0U5Uqo3RdA.text: Honestly I don't understand all the glowing reviews. It's an Indian restaurant  in the airport district with an unappealing second floor entry, sitting alongside hookah up bars and low end restaurants. That was a warning sign but I thought Vegas reviewers know their secret places. Not the case.   As far as the food goes, you could do much better in a run-of-the-mill Indian buffet restaurant than this place. I was there for dinner, and prices for basic vegetarian entrees run well over what I would pay in high-end places in DC metro area.  The samosa chickpeas had cheap oil fried samosas and canned chickpeas with powdered spice.  The naan disappointed with its low end flour.  The potato cumin had burnt cumin seeds taste. The dal makhani had honestly been cooked for half a day it seemed.  Maybe this is appealing to first timers and folks not too familiar with Indian food.  But anyone who has tried mainstream Indian or cooks at home and understands fresh, whole spice taste of any cuisine would know better.   The waiter was a good natured guy. I wouldn't ding the service. Nothing out of the ordinary.   The lighting was off with a stark tube light shining above and two endless looped Indian entertainment of second rate Bollywood.  But even novices know decent ambiance. This place disappointed.   I'll venture out to say many of the reviews may be gamed.  It was a sad start to a spring break in NV/AZ.

5l2LDD4J7N2GemglztILGw.text: Loved this place.. Food was amazing, staff was very nice & well informative and the views were romantic of the city with planes taking off and landing was cool..   Glad I went and will be going again..

ihLLGhxoLHO_zBAEx9I6Cw.text: I just discovered this place on a work trip to Vegas. It's right next to the airport.  My flight was delayed 3 hours so I went in search of food. Even as a fat kid I only got to try 3 items off the menu. The lamb Saag, vegetable samosas, and garlic naan. Everything was so fresh and delicious. The owner Raj and his family chatted me up at the bar and were gracious and friendly. Coming back soon. I didn't try them but Raj tells me the pork chops are baller af. Ambiance is upscale and service was great.

Lbia8CX_1Qm8hfxIzKShAw.text: Tried to go at 11:10pm and although there were people eating, they claimed they were closed and were not accommodating. That is 50 minutes before they are supposed to close. Waste of time. Lost my business forever.

efnI0W03TOhZZdNwFn7o8Q.text: Great service and excellent food - with a view!  My girlfriend and I had a really lovely evening here tonight!  The staff was friendly and knowledgable not to mention quick and attentive.   We ordered the Veggie Samosa to start which had great texture and flavor.  The outside was crisp and fluffy but not to greasy and the inside was warm and delicious.  Would certainly order these again.  Not to mention it paired perfectly with the Indian Beer the host recommended (Taj Mahal).  For the main course we went with butter chicken along with some Garlic and Cheese nan.  Spice level we chose was a level 8.  I would probably do a level 6 next time, but it still had excellent flavor.  The thick and rich curry was everything we were hoping it would be.  Certainly the best butter chicken that I have had in Las Vegas to date.  The Nan was also great.  My girlfriends cheese nan - which was quickly nick-named the nan-adilla - had cheese stuffed in the inside of the nan which offered a very refreshing twist in the midst of the spicy curry.  To top the evening off, I have to mention the view.  You have a spectacular view of the Las Vegas Strip, the Beautiful mountains, and if your a nerd like me, front row seats to all the jets flying in and out of McCareen international.  It was pretty great all around.  Will certainly be back. Had a great time and looking forward to returning soon!  Their lunch buffet is going to be our next visit, and we will most certainly be coming hungry :).

kCSbaA6dch7wx-X3yvkvSQ.text: Decided to go give a local business some support as I yearn for a curry every once in a while. We don't eat out that much. We did a groupon. Found the place fairly easily but when you get there, there are a couple of businesses on the lower floor. The entrance is on the side of the building and you have to go upstairs so a little odd. The decor is kind upbeat almost night-clubby feel. Definitely not the  traditional Indian curry house set up. Still the spices wafting through the air made us hungry and it wasn't long before our order hit the table. The place was not busy at all.  The waiter was friendly and attentive. The view was great as you could watch planes coming in to land at the airport. The meal was good although on the smaller portion side. We enjoyed it all overall and will go back for another shot unless we decide to try somewhere else. Got to spread the love!

Nb1zqEi-tO9EDtuZzpNh7Q.text: Best food in Las Vegas! I have ate Indian food at many places this restaurant beats all the places. They have Indian food and hooka while you wait for your meal. Mani makes you feel like your at home.

And with four of us at the table, we had the chance to try a number of dishes.  We have had Indian cuisine in other countries but most recently in Spain and England.  This restaurant tops them all!

LW7B7qgcUMzOYGZ77DKh0A.text: Best Indian food in Vegas yet by far! Great views . The food was fantastic. Service is a little slow but to be expected with a new restaurant. YcchN6bnD8O1lcPHZibq6w.text: Great service, great view....apps were tasty, ordered mild and my stomach was burning from the inside out.  Don't know if it was me or the food.  Haha, would definitely go back.

wIpRFPC-P_DKKI01CCeTOA.text: Simply amazing. The view from their second floor dining room is awesome. Service was fast, polite, and informative. Live music fit the vibe but still allowed for normal conversation.   As far as the food goes, some of the best Indian I've ever had. Samosas were as expected, but the chutney was pleasantly spicier than elsewhere. I love Tikka Masala and lamb dishes. So when I saw Lamb Tikka Masala, it was a no brainer. Astounding! Medium heat ended up being VERY tame, just the right amount of salt, good amount of meat. Friend got Rogan Josh, which was also fantastic. Garlic naan was flavorful but not overpowering. A single order of it was very generous. One way I always judge Indian restaurants, is their "water service". My cup never got below halfway before it was refilled and they didn't waste my time with ice (though they would if you asked).  I wish I could have eaten there twice in a row. For myself, This will become a must visit place when in Vegas.

O_MZPcffc3H7nYc2xdUY2Q.text: Fantastic food. Really good chicken tandoori. Curries and naan was very well made. Desserts (Ras malai and gulab jamun is sumptuous). The service is fast.

nNZj-qFUvqdT3_Mr0UK_vQ.text: We went here for a casual dinner during our Vegas trip. We ordered aloo gobi, paneer tikka masala (both medium spicy), garlic naan and aloo paratha. We are North Indians and we quite frequently try out different Indian restaurants. We can easily say the food here was amongst the best we have ever eaten in the U.S. The aloo gobi reminded us of the fare you would enjoy in Delhi dhabas! The staff was courteous and the view of the airport as well as the Vegas strip were like cherry on the top! For the location and the food, the price was appropriate (and they did not charge extra for onions lemons and chillies on the side like a lot of posh restaurants do!). Do give this a try if you are craving good Indian food in Vegas!  PS: we missed our flight this morning, so we are going back here for lunch before the next flight :D

6wJUDmnQUTFt6TBZETudKw.text: I've eaten here a couple of times.  The first time I visited was late night when this was about the only Indian restaurant open other than food courts on the strip.  It was a good experience . You get to see flights land at the airport across the strip while you eat .   I ordered the chicken vindaloo and lassi which was well prepared. I didn't realize that  the curry actually comes with complimentary rice and hence ended up ordering more naan's than necessary.  Over the week, I visited during the lunch hour as well and tried the buffet . The variety was great with a choice of north and South Indian food items.   It definitely seemed to be busy with teams from a number of offices seeming to come in for the lunch buffet.

TwE6WUKD77lRMyaB1wZg1g.text: Excellent lunch buffet. Service was amazing fast and polite. Food was some of the best indian buffet I've ever had, there was a wide selection, and kept fresh and hot. Setting was nice, 2nd floor view in a very clean maintained.

_IgnKuefOsc88QKNedy7yQ.text: If you come here on the weekend at 3 pm for the lunch buffet. Its worth it, despite the fact only 3 things are edible and the rest is personal preference.  The Butter Chicken,  The Chicken Tandoori, The Garlic Nan. You also get a choice of beverage, I just get the refillable soda.  If you come at any other time, Ordering a la carte is even better than buffet sometimes but you have to know what is what.  You can't be an Indian Foodie Newb because once you get it, you're committed. They don't sell combination things or whatever,  you pick the stew with the "Indian protein" of your choice and you better like it.  There are no photos, so ask ask ask, because a vindaloo, a korma, a curry and a Tikki masala are worlds apart.   If you've had indian food and like it, this place makes good food. If you've never tried indian food before, it might not be for you but that doesn't mean this place didn't make it right.

SPTo5K2EXPjqPmLSC9TBTQ.text: We love coming here for the view of the airport. In the evenings, you can see the plane fly and land. Food is great. We love the Paneer Pakora and vegetarian dishes like aloo gobi, Paneer tikka masala and malai kofta.

eYCGKsbd8a4HnWysbmaCZg.text: Pros: - Butter chicken & Palak Paneer was really good. - Ambiance was warm and modern - Service was very friendly - Restrooms were clean  Cons:  - Service was extremely slow - Naan was a bit hard - Music coming from the Hooka Lounge was too loud.  I would reccomend this restraunt.

--oIhOtqgI66ECGemIYBeQ.text: Best Indian Food in Town!!!   Whether you're a local or visiting from out of town and craving Indian food, Pure Indian is the place to go.  We usually go to their lunch buffets.  You get to try a variety of items and the views are pretty spectacular too.  You see the strip and the airport right outside the window.  I can't even tell you what is the best item to try because they are all amazing.  My favorites are Saag paneer, Daal, and aloo gobi.  My husband loves the butter chicken.  They bring out hot fresh naan that is delicious and soft.  I have yet to be disappointed.  I would also like to say if you're ever in need to throw a party, celebration dinner etc.  Manny (manager) will help you out! He was our man.  He helped us get together a menu, organize and execute an awesome party for our 4 year old.  Their staff was on point and very helpful.  Thank you Manny and Pure Indian staff for always exceeding our expectations!

El7iLnPr8bCBFR_p13QVcg.text: Pure Indian is the best! Great tables for watching the planes land! And the food! Omg the food! I had the tikka Massala it's sooo good the Naan bread is so fresh! Totally recommend!

gKQOYdNpMVzMz7mFTV0d8w.text: Wow... I don't even LIKE indian food.  I brought my husband b/c he loves it.  It was absolutely amazing.  We'll definitely be going back.  I love the atmosphere of this place and the view of the strip.  Prices are good.  What a find!!

3uD2EY_tzOLdxWFJaTM-sQ.text: Chicken Tikka is awesome, just ordered second plate of goat curry!! Scenic view of the strip and airport, a very exclusive feeling. This place is a hidden gem in Vegas. Above all else the food is truly delicious!!!!

NKr5O1SF68tFD_sCpANEeQ.text: Came here for the first time. Food was pretty good, nice ambience, nice views of the strip. Loved the mango lassi. Just the staff was alittle noisy forgetting our order. Dropping someone's else's order on our table. Yelling across the floor of peoples drink orders and food orders. Otherwise food was amazing.

Euz_CcFWqE1XOAtr5YtVyA.text: Nothing special.  It was okay for me.  Been to other buffets with similar dishes n was better tasting.

WiLjTTg7tHJPCxOLpm6Qxw.text: There's nothing I can say about this place in a negative light. Indian music, nice waitresses, and the food?....to die for.  This was my first time trying Indian cuisine and i assure you it won't be the last. If you ever plan to visit this place, you must try the Aloo Tikki, Vegetable pakora for appetizers and for the entre, order the Navaratan Korma. It's so good you will melt In your seat. Oh and be sure to let them know that you want it mild (unless you have a high tolerance for spicy food) I don't so getting the mild was perfect for me.  As if the ambience itself wasn't enough, you look outside and there is the beautiful strip with airplanes zipping across on the runway.   Just as we were departing, a woman joined the band and started singing in one of the most beautiful voices I've heard in a while. Come here to relax and eat like a king.   The best part about this whole experience is that it's only about 10 minutes from me. So I will definitely return.

_c7S6kejOr-ZdncmNSttWg.text: I was craving indian food today and decided to order and have it delivered.   The order was on time and correct.   This was the first time eating food from this Indian restaurant.  I found the establishment on Yelp with very good reviews.  I was also able to place the order through yelp.  The food was absolutely amazing.   Very flavorful  and not too hot.  I ordered chicken curry,  butter chicken and tandoori chicken along with 2 orders of garlic naan.  My favorite  was the butter chicken.   The best i have ever eaten.  Even better than what i make.  The food was packaged nicely and still hot and fresh.  There were two complaints.   My son said I should have ordered more naan and the dishes were too small for the price.  For the items and tax, delivery, total was over $60.00.   I agree but I also realize that you pay for convenience and we were being lazy today.  There wasn't one bite of anything remaining.   I am very anxious to try their lunch buffet now.  I'll definitely post some pictures when I do.

YW-QohDB5vQ1F_jb6pFIRw.text: My husband and I thought the food was delicious! We've been trying to find a food place for Indian Food and finally found one! The service was great and the view is amazing!!!  We will definitely be back!

zIJL47KCyeK1PBELjPebRg.text: The staff is friendly, food is prepared promptly.  The place is very clean.  The Spinach dish was terrific, the vegetable korma was runny like soup - so it was a disappointment.  We'll try it again, but won't get the vegetable korma.  Update:  We went again with my brother from Denver - everything was perfect, excellent waiter.  This time the vegetable korma was excellent as was everything else - really tasty garlic Naan bread and mango kulfi for desert.  Highly recommended - but be warned - it cost over one hundred and twenty bucks to feed three people - and we didn't even order alcohol.

Ubl8UgUGbuxWboXjoNW3sA.text: Well-recommended.   This venue is easy to overlook; I've driven past it a hundred times ... and eventually became curious about it. It's directly across the street from the McCarran viewing area on Sunset Road, up in the second floor of a two-story building. (Down on the first floor is a restaurant named Kabob.) All the parking out front is marked "Kabob only." So I swung around to the back of the building, into the underground parking area. There's an elevator in there that shoots right up to this restaurant on the second floor.  The space is nicely appointed, with a bar section at back and a separate hookah area facing west. But the star of the show here is the view. Pure-five-star, that is. Huge windows, on three sides. Not only the close-up look-see of all the landings and take-offs at McCarran, but, at a distance, an entirely unobstructed view of the length of the Strip ... and, better yet, an entirely unobstructed 270-degree view of all the gorgeous mountains that surround our Valley.   There's a $12 AYCE Indian lunch buffet until 3pm, with many of the usual suspects on display. I don't know Indian cuisine very well, but I've certainly dined many Indian lunch buffets and found plenty to like here. I dipped into a bit of everything (except the Tandoori Chicken). There was Butter Chicken (in butter-tomato sauce similar to Tikka Masala) that I especially enjoyed, a chili-fish entree that was spicy indeed, and savory goat curry. And the kheer rice pudding desert, sweet and minty. All thumbs-up yum. The garlic naan was the fluffiest, most generous portion I've ever seen anywhere.   This venue apparently also offers a $15 Saturday/Sunday AYCE brunch deal here as well, that comes with a bit of bubbly. And it appears that it is open very late, some nights until 3am. And there was a sign promoting live music 6pm to 10pm on Friday & Saturday. My entertainment was one of those Indian music video channels ... that are always entertaining over lunch. And the breath-taking view.  Check it out!

khABAOm938QrqjZcnCxyww.text: Food is delicious and the staff is at tentative and genuine. The view of the airport and the strip is unbeatable.. perfect date night or family outing.

OChyLNWBD5Shg6LfEiwUOQ.text: Me and my boyfriend were craving Indian food, so we decided to come here for a late night dinner after shopping. Checked Yelp for the hours of operation & fortunately enough, they close at 3am. We kinda got lost on which building in the complex it was because it was dark out and the sign they had outside wasn't very visible unless you're really looking for it.   The restaurant is upstairs, where we passed by a hookah lounge (which I believe has the same owner as the restaurant). Came in and was greeted by the staff. The guy let us pick our own table, especially because there was only one other table there at the time.   They provide an appetizer of thin bread with a green and brown dip. I personally preferred the brown one for the crackers/bread. We ordered:  Chicken Tandoori - it's a big "appetizer" which we ate as an entree. Try it with the green dip that came with the thin bread appetizer  Chicken Masala - great with rice. All their entrees come with rice. It's $3 more for each extra order of rice.  Both our orders were definitely five stars! They were delicious and full of flavor. The two were plenty for the both of us.   I appreciate the most: the view of the restaurant. I enjoy watching the planes land, so the view was great.Especially at night. There was also live music there and an open bar.  Improvement: it was a little hard communicating with the staff so it caused us to ask so many questions and ask for items every time they came back.

RkXQYMoEiJAPlddxe6dcaQ.text: Yelp says they're open until midnight, but they're only actually open until 11:30 and turn you away if you try to eat in the last 30m.  Since many many many people use yelp and the "open now" feature to find late-night food, this listing is effectively screwing us over.

I6RF4FwVyZ4BYLouSsZvvg.text: We came to this place twice when we visited Vegas,  both times during the lunch buffet. The food is very tasty and everyone in our group enjoyed it - most of us vegetarians, and were pleased that there were plenty of veggie options along with the non-veg options .  Cons: we were charged 14.99 the first time we visited and 11.99 the 2nd time for the buffet. The one star that I have taken off is only due to the fact that we felt little cheated on being charged extra the first time, when we didn't really want to order any drinks (were not told about the 11.99 option).

photos.caption: Photo of Pure Indian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2TBwekGXmknEmeKHDFp9JA.text: OMG! So, so, so good. We continually told each other how amazing each bite tasted. They served Pappadom with mint and mango chutney. We started with Lasoni Gobi, which is butter fried cauliflower in a spicy, tangy sauce. This is our first time trying it. Again so, so amazing. As a new vegetarian, it was a revelation about just how wonderful vegetables can be. Yes, I know it's not the healthiest item I could have chosen, but it was worth it.  Next was the Navaraton Korma. The sauce was different from other Kormas I have tried, but I loved it more with every bite. The veggies were just crisp enough to stand up to the sauce. We ordered garlic Naan and scooping the sauce up with that was a mouthwatering experience. My D/H ordered Mushroom Masala. It was also0 wonderful. For dessert, which we questioned even ordering, we shared a rice pudding. Now, I am not a big fan of rice pudding, but I didn't want to stop eating this one. I did though and pushed it to hubby.  I am aware that this is a gushing review, but the food was seriously that good. The service was wonderful also. They were almost tripping over each other to check in us and take our orders.l There is a nice view of the airport and the decor is simple.   I hate to tell you to try this place because it might make it harder for us to get in, but seriously,  check it out. You won't regret it.

js8Um0ugq_sjRz2O3lSC8A.text: My wife and I have finally found great Indian food in Las Vegas and it's name is Pure.   My wife is vegetarian and the options fill two plus pages. She got the Manchurian vegetables and they were perfectly cooked, the sauce had great flavor and it was cooked crispy.   I had the goat curry and loved it. The spicing was fantastic and the goat tender and flavorful.   The naan was fresh and tasty as was the yellow daal.   We will definitely be back.   Hats off to Mani who took care of us, he was great.

XVk3_znx8HRlZNqDxlZOyw.text: At last, at last, we found amazing Indian food in Vegas. We have tried quite a few places in town and had decent meals but nothing that we ever craved so badly that we changed all plans to get tikka masala pronto. Until now.  We have a toddler so instead of bringing him to the restaurant and disrupting the meals of other diners, we've ordered take out from here 3 times in the last 3 weeks and I have no plans on stopping. I also can't wait to actually dine here and try some of the seafood dishes.   The chicken and lamb tikka masalas are the best I've ever had. I love ordering raita and having that in between bites of the rich masala dishes.   We've also had the tandoori chicken which was also excellent. The garlic naan is fine, just what we expected. We've also tried the coconut curry chicken dish and it was good but similar to the tikka masala. So I'll stick with the TM and try something different next time. I also saw they have a lunch buffet so we'll be sure to check that out.   We've loved everything we've tried and can't wait till our next Pure Indian meal.  Since we order to-go quite frequently (see toddler above) I also very much appreciate the care they take in preparing the to go orders. Everything is wrapped and sealed to preserve heat and prevent spilling.   We typically spend about $50-$60 for 2 and a 1/2 of us which is an expensive to go order but I'm telling you it's worth it. We should have leftovers but we rarely do because it's that good. Go Now.

s4sRtTVAehfv_-LWxbAHQg.text: I have never actually eaten *inside* the restaurant so I can't comment on that. We have ordered take out or delivery from here A LOT because it's one of the only places near our home that is open late. You can order online easily and we have never had to wait outrageously long for delivery.   The food always holds up well and has been consistently delicious. We end up ordering the butter chicken a lot. I also like the lamb saag and samosas. We usually also have leftovers as you get a large portion. Can't wait to try their buffet!

tuOJFLwQZ2iqY45AFzv5KQ.text: Great Indian food! Awesome view on the strip and airport at night.   Had butter chicken and garlic naan, it was awesome. The only thing that I could mention is that there could have been some more rice.

SO SO SO GOOD. Wonderful live music while you eat and amazing strip views and you can watch the planes arriving into the airport.

MSzo0uLAKDuS6mQrPD0odQ.text: This place is delicious with very sweet wait staff. The view of the runways at night is amazing.

Nwc-hYturbrUl6DwKVDyVg.text: One of the best Indian restaurants not just in Vegas but in the west coast! The hostesses, the servers and the manager were amazing people. What was a bonus was the hookah place managed by the same peeps!  Food: 4.5 (we were so into the place and music, we couldn't finish everything we ordered) Ambience: 5.5 if I can give Management: 5 Cost: 4.5  Just one of the best places to have gone to at 4.00 in the evening and having the best 4 hours with service throughout!   Going back today just to have more fun if not the same from yesterday!   Thank you guys for being amazing (to the team)!! Cheers

Ybt_54M8B1Yz8-vLqYDHeg.text: Tried this place tonight and loved it. Had the saag paneer & butter chicken with garlic naan. Everything was very good... naan was crispy and hot, rice was fluffy. Our favorite part was the view -- this restaurant is on the second level of a building on E Sunset with a perfect, unobstructed view of the strip and Mccarran airport ... you can watch planes land and take off while enjoying your dinner. Service was swift and friendly. Give it a try!

jT-IQ3U0NDh56PqLPXmJYQ.text: Not sure why people like it here. I'm definitely not going back. The location is odd. The restaurant is oddly set up and the buffet seems a little dirty. The service is lack luster and I can't say I found any of it very tasty. I prefer Mint Bistro and probably any of the other Indian places I've been seem to be cleaner and friendlier.

96aPc2TAjdO8DPqR73_I8g.text: This probably is the worst Indian buffet experience I had may be after India palace in flagstaff but at least they had chicken in chicken curry. Here they had potato. It took them 20 mins to bring naan and they even weren't busy, very slow staff. Go to mint I can here since there was waiting there

DZb9OqBoxH0FWHrRep6dJA.text: UNPROFESSIONAL. I purchased a Groupon for their restaurant about 2 days ago and I couldn't wait. I heard so many good reviews. Since I am here in town on vacation, I decided to pay them a visit! Unfortunately I was completely disappointed. I had drove ridiculously far to only get turn away. They said the Groupons couldn't be applied to lunch. The waiter said "there is a sign on the door" which doesn't even justify why it still couldn't be applied to lunch. The sign said "no coupons allowed this week". Pissed, I walked out and re-read the terms on the Groupon deal. However, there was no statement or terms that declared lunch wasn't an option. Never will return back. I don't appreciate taking the time out of my day to head out and only get turned away rudely.

QRVSldc5NhPDWOnMTR0GSA.text: Great view great great food! Ugh!! Just ask the server what's the best to eat here and they'll tell you. My server recommended chicken tiki masala and best yet!   Thank God! And the chip bread and dips for complimentary appetizers were

lw_-mKKHgTjPuYiZTMEj3A.text: Delicious food, reasonable prices and great service!  Mani is a great manager and really takes care of the customers.  Food is delicious - don't skip the chai tea, so good.  Portions are generous :0)

lwcIhwb6dHNthR0LBEM0GQ.text: Hadn't had Indian food for over a decade and got forced into the experience... and what a pleasant one it was!  Food and service were excellent and the tika massawa was incredibly yummy. I had a kabob dish which is best not so well done. My friend had a spicy (grade 7/10) orange chicken dish which was very tasty too.   Watching aircraft land/take off was a scenic bonus.

PxNLS7BaJSBWClLoV1Qusw.text: Food was freakin delicious I have zero compliments! Can't wait to head over for their champagne brunch!

X3ejWxtRFMhYqhyD5y4Iow.text: By far the best Indian food I've had. Everything I had tasted wonderful. The service was amazing. My husband and I ordered tea and our server said it didn't come out the perfect way so if it was ok for him to remake it and take 2 more minutes. We really appreciated that. Definitely coming back!

42sMYx6bm3qoYYNSrhIP4A.text: Maybe we came on an off night--I suppose that could happen. But, once we were seated, it took 10 minutes to get menus. We ordered samosas, naan, rice and bharta. Food took about 40 minutes to arrive and samosas never came. We asked for them 3 times and they finally brought them after we had finished everything else. Everything was SO salty. We are huge fans of Indian food and have eaten it all over the world, and this was the saltiest we had ever experienced. It was also pretty bland and mediocre otherwise. Sadly, this was a one-star experience all around for us.

22IEL87x7pdhJSohOSy1gA.text: Delicious food and amazing staff. Shahi paneer, butter chicken recommended.  Had a flight to catch, they had very fast service.  Rasmalai and gulab jamun recommended. Got free gulab jamun on the house.

0_kCxPqvWEjaxYpIAwPxLw.text: We ordered delivery and I cannot day enough good stuff!!  Food came quick and hot, and SOOOOO YUMMY!! I have been struggling since getting back from India to find authentic Indian food with lots of flavor and spice that isn't watered down or full of butter, tomato or cream as filler.  Everything was super flavorful, even the white rice had whole peppercorn and coriander in it... they really went the extra mile to make sure that the food was an experience and that each component was flavorful.  Just be mindful that's what you're getting, lots of flavor and lots of spice... so if you're used to bland, creamy, mild, weak stuff, it's not going to be for you....

photos.caption: Photo of Pure Indian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Excuse our messy table

NKul9Uj3zxwcz1UilIvXDg.text: Been there a few times a while ago. It has been good. Since the food is always the same for the buffet, I took a break. Went there again yesterday and it was bad. The items for the buffet are more or less the same but it was not good at all. Maybe the chef changed, I am not sure. There was masala dosa in the buffet with no masala. Go figure. I tasted most of the food on the menu and none tasted good. Some had no salt. Some tasted sweet when it is not supposed to. Seems like I am not going there anytime soon unless something changes.

Z5KdGcLBTbFtbDZ7pGOyAA.text: This is our second visit to Pure and it was delicious again. This time we had: Chicken Tikka Masala Lamb Tikka Masala Chicken Vindaloo Garlic Naan Vegetable Samosa Paneer Korma I really enjoyed the Tikka Masala dishes. Really creamy and flavorful. Next time I'll try the Spicy heat instead of Medium.

d9Y1gioVEclFprWoVB7mHA.text: I dropped by for dinner with my family.  My family is somewhat unfamiliar with Indian cuisine so I ended up ordering a couple of my favorites and some of the classics for them to try.  I ordered the chicken tikka masala, lamb rogan josh, dal tadka, and malal kofta along with a side of garlic naan.  Their dal tadka and malal kofta were really good and reminded me a lot of my favorite Indian restaurant in New York.  My family enjoyed all the dishes too and it was a great experience for them.  Our server Nikita was wonderful and was all smiles for us.  This place has only been open for a couple months and it's far off the strip but it's a gem and well worth a visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Pure Indian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lamb rogan josh, malal kofta, chicken tikka masala, and dal tadka.  The dal tadka and malal kofta were delicious!

Gy6n_hFYF3jBGHDyxWyC9g.text: One of the best experience ever. Ordered Lamb Chops and was surprised by the size and perfectly cooked. Great atmosphere and best view of strip. So far our favorite Indian restaurant in Vegas. Will be back again next week for more Garlic Naan, Lamb Chops and Chicken Korma. Employees were the best and very well dressed!

rSCai2ERe96Htydlo_vzAg.text: We were heading out of Vegas after vacation and decided to stop at this restaurant right near the airport since we were craving for Indian food. There was a mix-up leading to a delay in our order. However, I was very impressed by the staff going out of the way to compensate for the error. The food itself was absolutely amazing, although we had very less time to gulp it down before our flight. We ordered a Kadai paneer with naan and it was absolutely delicious.

tQm2s66CX3O6o2r3sQAlGQ.text: Worst food in las Vegas. Found insect in the food, when asked shown rude behavior. They serve the previous day and old food for buffet. Ala carte is served from buffet items. Please avoid and save your bucks..

1ns0xh6vo9EJJO0OV60snA.text: This is a really good Indian restaurant. The view is great because it's next to the airport so you can see the strip and the planes landing. They have a hookah lounge in the same building as well so if your looking for food and hookah, this is the place

EVcp1RLFp4JaU5AvkmfHdg.text: I came here for the buffet with a friend and everything was delicious! Beautiful city and airport view! They also serve fresh naan. Highly recommend.

Gkd9RurQf9mfhlZclG-KeQ.text: I have been coming to Vegas for last 7 years and not sure why I missed this gem of place . We checked in The restaurant at 11:45 pm on a Friday night . Craving for Indian food had just gone up after spending the day in Grand Canyon.  Restaurant has wonderful ambience and offers wonderful views of Vegas skyline.   Coming to food, we ordered Shahi Paneer, Shahi Rajma and Aloo Parathas. All the items were very delicious and authentic! Would love to return to this place.   If I were to rate the Indian restaurants for authentic food and ambience in Vegas , it will be on top !

ZRU-ljO6G8-IThGFHVfpUQ.text: I could not give 0 stars. We came in hoping it to be a good place to eat but had a horrible experience.  After 15 mins no one gave us even the menu. We literally went ahead and picked it up ourselves.   At 20 mins in we place our entire order at once.   At 30 min in we got one of our 2 beverages and were told the order should be in 5 more mins.  People who came after us started getting food. Our waiter also brought wrong table's food to us.  At 40 mins in we were told one more min.  At 50 mins, still no food, still one more min.  At 60 mins, Asked our waiter is it really one min or your fake one. He said he hasnt given the order to the kitchen. We had to walk out empty stomach.   WORST WAITER EVER!!!! Super Pissed off

XgVF0LTFJFgQqDAynPrZKg.text: After spending couple of days in Zion and eating pizza almost everyday we were craving for some comfort food! Glad that we decided to stop at this place while in Vegas. Love love the food at this place. There is a reason why this place gets a 4 star and I want all yelpers to make a mental note of the fact that not to visit it between 2:30 to 3:30. Around this time the restaurant staff is just don't with their buffet and are busy cleaning/winding up that to start Ala carte. They wouldn't tell you this but you would be impacted directly as your food would take a good 45-60 mins to come. Even the waiter wouldn't come to take your order for 15-20 mins. I get that they might be busy after a busy morning but then shut the restaurant down for couple of hours to clean up. So all you yelpers I don't want you to miss on the awesome food but just take into account the timing before you visit.  In terms of food this place does take spice levels seriously so when you choose 8/10 in spice level it is good spicy. We ordered paneer karhai, dal tadka, mango lassi and garlic naan. Portions were pretty generous for just the two of us so I would recommend only getting either the curry or dal if you are not that hungry(of course assuming you are a party of 2 or less). They serve complimentary papdam with two chutneys too. Food was really authentic and delicious. It seemed a little pricey but I am willing to pay more for good quality food. Even the basmati rice which comes with the curry seemed good in taste and flavorful. Definitely would recommend this place to anyone who is in Vegas and craving for Indian food!

nGJLX03Xju5gIq_zPFzNRw.text: I've been coming to this restaurant for years and have enjoyed my experience every time I've come in.    I've never ordered off the menu and have always been here for the lunch buffet.    The buffet is very well priced and has a good assortment of items.  I've never come in where the food wasn't fresh or delicious.  Is it the best Indian food I've ever had in my life?  No.  But the value for the price is absolutely above average.  The butter chicken is particularly good, as well as the garlic naan.    I really enjoy the mango lassi and the desserts off of the buffet as well.    The view here is fantastic.  I love watching airplanes and when you're here for lunch and the sun is shining, you can't ask for much more.

IP2em7p0uSMt0VP2SYwINA.text: Really good food. Large Portions. Reasonable Prices. The food is spiced beautifully - even the samosas and the rice are fragrant with spice. It's all in the details.   I always wind up taking some food home. Frankly, with an appetizer and bread, a single entree is plenty for two. If you're with friends, order several dishes, and share!  I've never been for the buffet, but I've enjoyed every dish that I've ever ordered. My current favorites are the Saag Paneer and the Chicken Tikka Masala.  The Naan Bread is fantastic.   My experience is that the heat level is a bit on the low side. Your experience may vary.

JEW7Ac2bByfE-vHSlcSuhQ.text: When it comes to world cuisine, none is so well known for its bold and spicy flavor as Indian cuisine. Curries, rice dishes, vegetarian and vegan dishes, and copious amounts of spice are associated with this type of food -- and not surprisingly, Las Vegas has multiple Indian restaurants in town, testifying to its great popularity. Pure Indian Cuisine is one of those restaurants, with the added bonus of boasting a great view of the Las Vegas Strip and McCarran Airport due to its Sunset Road location.  As it is close to my workplace, Pure is one of my go-to places for lunch when work is slow -- though I haven't gone often as of late due to being both overly busy and not being in the mood for spicy food when it's already oppressively hot outside. This visit was a result of my Indian food craving winning out over the weather, LOL.  Though I was seated in the middle of the restaurant, the dining room is open enough that you can get a good view of the Strip and McCarran Airport from anywhere you're seated -- of course, the window seats are prized for a reason!  When it comes to the food, the restaurant has the usual selection of curries, rice dishes, and vegetarian options -- however, to my pleased surprise, they had both butter chicken and dal makhani available among the offerings! So of course I got plenty of both dishes; spicy, flavorful, and very decadent, both these dishes ( chicken and lentils, respectively ) are among my favorite Indian foods for a reason. However, they also had plenty of other go-to options like tandoori chicken, salads and dosa that ensure you'll be coming back for more!  Of course, I had to be cognizant enough after lunch to be able to stay awake at work, so I ate less than usual -- which isn't that much of a difference considering how rich Indian food tends to be. Still, everything I had at Pure was delicious, which is why it is one of my two go-to Indian restaurants in town ( the other to be reviewed in the future ). One could even say it was purely divine-- okay, I'll stop, I know that was bad. But if you're near the area, why not try Pure Indian Cuisine? A world of flavor awaits your taste buds.

photos.caption: Photo of Pure Indian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert: kheer and mango custard. 5/5.
Photo of Pure Indian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. What a view of McCarran Airport! It&#39;s fun to watch planes landing from up here.
Photo of Pure Indian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Plate one: butter chicken, tandoori chicken, dal makhani with rice, and uttapam dosa. 5/5 -- all delicious!

wbY4_FkPiEOLMSTTDgB9cA.text: So Happy!   Yep, so happy to have tried out this place and I love it.  Having been to India several times, and enjoying also Indian food in other places of the world, I have to say that I really enjoyed Pure Indian Cuisine.  1. Location - What an odd location, on top of a two story building where all the parking is reserved for the Kabob restaurant downstairs.  Good news, you can park in the basement and take the elevator right up to the second floor to the restaurant.  2. The View - It is still odd when you are on the second floor and you first see the Hookah Lounge.  But once you go down a small hallway, you get to Pure and then you are rewarded by the most wonderful simple view of Las Vegas and the runway of the airport.  It is simple, cool and fun just to check out the view and the plans landing!  3. Ambiance - Night and day, they have done a great job with this place.  Most seats have a great view and there are plenty of seats for a cozy party of 2 or 4 or they can string together a table for more!  4.  Service - Top notch!  I have enjoyed the service by them.  Nice recommendations and they can customize dishes for you.  5. The Food - While I love Indian food, I am 100% not an expert. I cannot tell you about all the curry's or the spices and I cannot remember all the types, but I can tell you when I am craving comfort food, Indian food is one of my go-to dishes when I am traveling!  Based on several visits, here is a sampling of what we tried.  Everything is sharable!  Pappadam- First out they always serve you some Pappadam with some Chutney.  Fresh, hot and crispy, a nice way to start the meal and to nibble on this thin bread/cracker.  Garlic Naan - We have ordered always the garlic naan bread to accompany our meal. Nothing like some nice naan to soak up the sauces.  They have regular naan, garlic naan and about a dozen or so other types of naan.  I like my naan plain or garlic since I am using it with my main dishes and the other selections they have are stuffed with many other lovely things.  Veggie Dishes - Have tried the Channa Masala ( Chickpeas), the Aloo Gobi (Potatoes and Cauliflower), Hyderabadi Vegetable Curry (Mixed Veggies) and the Bhindi Masala( Chrispy fried Okra).  My hands down favorite what the Hyderabadi and first time every to try it. The waiter recommended it for my daughter who is vegan and she loved it.  All the dishes were tasty by the way. The Bhindi has a crispy texture and perhaps while all the other dishes were empty, there was a bit of the Okra left...  Chicken - Who doesn't like chicken.  We love it, but we can't take the heat, so we have tried over time several.  The Chicken Korma, in a nice creamy mild curry sauce was good. So was the Chicken Tikka Masala, yes, I did have to try what is basically now a British National Dish, chicken in a nice red creamy sauce.  I still wonder if this was invented in India or in England??? We also have had the Tandoori Chicken, 8 big pieces of perfectly tender baked chicken and just a perfect blend of moist and spicy morsels of goodness.  Baaaaa- Yep, we had some Lamb and Goat.  For the Lamb, we had the Lamb Rogan Josh, a wonderful red curry with boneless bits of lamb.  Obviously, I needed some meat on the bone, so I also ordered the Goat Karahi,  I never had the Karahi style before, but the waiter recommended it.  I have ordered it now three times, or every time we have been here!  Bone in pieces of goat meat cooked in a tomato onion blend of mouthwatering and bone gnawing joy.  Beer, wine and everything for your thirst quenching needs.  They have quite the bar, so you should be pleased.  Note, I did not use a menu for this, just a glass of red or a bud light...  GK says, check this place out. I think you will like it a lot!

lu11BJs54HXyG22lYjoONw.text: This is the best Indian cuisine that I have had in Vegas. The service was excellent and the food was prepared pretty much to our liking and taste. The ambience was awesome! Would definitely recommend coming at night. The vibrant Vegas skyline and the planes taking off alongside is a treat. All in all definitely worthy of 5 stars! Keep it up

DhnSsak7xVwKbczDOtJQYA.text: Whatever you do, DO NOT ORDER TAKEOUT. Anytime you order through a 3rd party delivery app, they don't even BEGIN preparing the delivery until after the scheduled pickup time. It's 15-20 min late EVERY SINGLE time, and there's never even anyone in the restaurant.

qRZWOiP9O-rQXFukftoRxQ.text: I would have liked to give a higher rating for this restaurant, but the service left me unimpressed. My server seemed less than thrilled about my arrival. I was dining alone on a Saturday evening. He never asked if I wanted something other than water to drink. I ordered vegetable samosa, dal soup, garlic naan and goat vindaloo. The samosas were a little greasy but tasty. The dal soup tasted watered down like someone was trying to stretch the pot. The naan and vindaloo were amazing. It was too bad that my server disappeared and I had to wait for more than 20 minutes for a togo box and my check which was brought to me by another server. Once I ordered, I never saw my original server again. Strange if you ask me.

DhFGThIWhwJq2HXBZXBmDw.text: We were all so hungry and thought everything closes late at night and found this place on Yelp that was open until 3am.  The food was fantastic, the service was slow. Had to keep asking for things over and over that they had forgotten. It wasn't incredibly busy either.  The winners were the lamb keema naan (stuffed ground lamb inside the bread) and the paneer tikka masala.  The rest was just 'okay' and heard they have a lunch buffet that is only $12 per person and on the weekends they have a brunch.  Would love to come back and sample different items. Hope they can work on their service as it was painful.
