AI6VZgdNnY39KXX7zac4Kw.text: What a nice restaurant with an amazing view of the strip and airport runways. This hidden gem is upstairs from a Kabob place and next to a hookah lounge in what feels like a business park. The best part is, they're open until 3am.   I've only been here a couple times but the service has always been great. The tables and booths are very clean and comfortable and the view is amazing.   The food is also great - we wanted a gobi manchurian (basically general tso's sauce on deep fried cauliflower) but they only have a vegetable manchurian on the menu. The chef was nice enough to accommodate us.   Also ordered the Punjabi Chicken curry - the chicken was so tender and breaks apart so easily on your fork. Full of flavor with a nice thick curry sauce, just the way I like it. Came with some beautiful fragrant rice, freshly made.   The best part - this was at almost 2am. I can't think of anywhere else that you can get quality Indian cuisine at this hour. I'm dying to come back and try the lunch buffet.

djkhoKw8McFi8as56zALAg.text: Literally one of the best Indian restaurants in the USA. We were tired of finding vegetarian friendly and not vegan friendly places, had to resort to eating Italian Food. This was a much needed experience.  We ordered the Paneer Makhani, Dal Tadka and Jeera Aaloo and Garlic Naan. The quantity was generous and food was finger licking good.   The place is super clean too which I appreciated.   A must stop if you are in Vegas and love vegetarian or Indian food.

GnvqzXbE9zNWXI4PqPL9vw.text: A vegetarian's review: It's a place with lovely food, nice drinks and a stunning view of the runway.. u will see an airplane landing and taking-off every 2nd minute.. We ordered Paneer Tikka, Paneer Tikka Masala and Naan and simply loved it ! And their drinks are pretty strong

mqwS61XL5ZOXuSokpl82Pg.text: Food was delicious. Ordered lamb, chicken, and goat. All very good. The samosas are huge! I know this may sound funny, but I wish they were a little smaller. The homemade tea is outstanding!! Hot but not too hot that you'll burn your mouth because of impatience. Perfect blend of spices.  The service was fine for us. The waiter was friendly and took our order in a reasonable amount of time. I prefer the lady that brought us our food and checked on us. She was friendly and chatted a little with us. I enjoyed that.  As for the table next to us, it took a very, very long time for someone to take their order. I felt bad for them.

7ct1XZy3nn5FxBZNmORCJg.text: My hubby & I found this place on Friday night & we were SO pleasantly surprised. The food is amazing, the view is awesome & the service was great. We ordered purely based on our server's recommendations & everything was delicious. After dinner, we stopped by the hookah lounge & stayed for hours. It was a great date night & we will be back sooner rather than later!

4Q4fSjpt4E4xafxWd-Jqqg.text: In Vegas for the weekend and was looking for a local spot to grab something good to eat. Came across this place on a quick search and decided to give it a try. Not bad at all! They have a buffet with pretty good choices. My favorite is the butter chicken. They also bring some pretty good naan to the table. Only complaint is they don't keep the buffet replenished quickly. But other than that I say it is a pretty good place to try Indian cuisine.

T13VioERbxpLXu4j3WAw2A.text: Authentic Indian (Punjabi) cuisine, decent service, clean, and opens until 3 am. They have plenty of space to be seated and a nice view of the runway to catch plane land or take-off from the table (exciting).   There is a hookah bar adjoining the restaurant which plays loud music and shares a door that open in the restaurant. A big turn-off was the music playing in the restaurant or adjoining hookah bar. The restaurant was loud may be due to dance and music in the adjoining bar. At the time of my visit post-midnight the doors between the two were kept open and not just the music the smell of hookah was also free flowing. If I wanted to enjoy loud music or hookah smell, I wouldn't be visiting the restaurant for a peaceful dining experience.  It would be best if they keep the door between the bar and the restaurant closed. Also play a soft music in the restaurant than a loud one.  Their food is to the point and delicious. Rest assured, for better north Indian flavors, visit them and you won't be disappointed.

mWtJ9pc4rDZBtGXuR9UUpw.text: Absolutely delicious and close to the airport as well!  A sever named "Moni" or "Mani" helped me.  He introduced me to Taj Mahal beer which had a smooth, yet crisp taste.  Buffet options on 7/18 included veggie samosa, butter chicken, chicken vindaloo, dosa, tandoori chicken, dum aloo.  All were appropriately seasoned, with distinct flavor profiles for each dish.  The cold bar has raita, kheer, salad, and a large assortment of chutneys. You also get a fresh basket of naan with the buffet.  All for $11.95.  I highly recommend this place if you're looking for Indian food on the way in or out of LAS.  The service team checked in with me regularly and I have absolutely no complaints about this establishment.

a9OUf-P7Njsq5n-gwlTTCw.text: Thank you mani for all the service the he provided. Mani has been great. I took my wife here for dinner date. Mani has made our date remembered. I highly recommend this place because of mani. We tried hookah and dinner which was wonderful.  Thank you for all the customer services provided by mani. Dinner,Drink and hookah was wonderful.

ofP16FHOoXwWU6p6VM2Aug.text: I ate at Pure for the first time today and had a first-rate experience. Every aspect exceeded expectations from the view, to the service and especially the food! I tried five different items from their buffet lunch, and everything was delicious! Our waiter, Prashant, was very helpful and provided great service. The view overlooking the airport and the Strip is a great as well. I highly recommend trying them out today.

Xjlp5mrvTx4EwiE8EU-0Yg.text: Excellent representative of traditional Indian cuisine. Flavorful dishes, attentive service. Loved it!

QhgnycWPCDpQyIh8s1hVUA.text: You must try this restaurant!! You will not be disappointed! The food is always delicious, the service is excellent and you get a wonderful view of McCarran's runways. Who could ask for more?!

JbzgZK_55rua9sS6zI0n8Q.text: Great service and great food! Carlos is the best server. Nice atmosphere and amazing view! Love it. Can't wait to come back.

_aQnKGrTM1aivA1up95gDg.text: Hands down, the best Indian food in Vegas!  Food 5/5- We ordered the chicken vindaloo and the chicken Karahi with garlic naan. Spice level is made to order and if you want to sweat, this is the place for you.   Drinks 4/5- Good selection of Indian beers as well as full bar.   Hookah 4+/5- Good variety of flavors; just make sure to ask for the larger coals.   View 5+/5- GREAT view of the strip and an amazing place to watch the sunset.   Service 5/5- Very attentive waitstaff that is quick to respond to any request! Ask for Nikita or Raj!  Overall, if you are craving AMAZING Indian food you NEED to check this place out!

5uJsZkxXgXLuJZAjbFpJlQ.text: Food is fresh and very tasty. It's more authentic and on the spicier side, which is how it should be. Weekend buffet includes free soft drinks, chai tea and limit one of beer and champagne. Mani deserves a raise.

fyKVzJHTTazC65r-wj5nkQ.text: Ultimate experience! authentic Indian food in Vegas! excellent selection of beer! mani took great care of us

WXu-Wr9qjEK_arwBxzxknQ.text: Delicious Indian food with a beautiful view of the planes taking off and landing! An awesome way to enjoy a dinner out! Hookah lounge connected.

FWhHP69bBVsIzF9e9-l4SA.text: This place was awesome with a great view. My husband and I went for dinner and there was music. There is also a hookah lounge next door. Just a great local night out kinda place.

6GfkDlRyrmEB9yh0g_JQkQ.text: Very good food along with good service.server was very nice and polite and the view thru the window is outstanding..will surely come back again

ait8T5YYXXXy2QHr4fBK7Q.text: Everything from the view to the food and the service were all AMAZING! Nikita was our server and she was super attentive, patient and great at explaining what dishes were what and helping us decide what to order. Great experience will definitely come back.

XHl6IOrJfyIsnigIp7iKqg.text: Our third visit here and it just keeps getting better and better.  I tried the lamb saag and it was the best dish I've ever had here.  Everything is tasty and flavorful and does not disappoint.  Staff is alway attentive, friendly and remembers us from our previous visits. Great keyboard music goes along with the great airport view.

hkYxW29V5RVCmEtKIeJB1g.text: Very good restaurant. Plentiful lunch buffet. Dinner with reasonable prices and flavorful dishes. Much recommended. Mani deserves a special shout out for being friendly, professional and super nice.

HRFfu86v-wlPKUTRKXoJJg.text: This is my favorite Indian food in Vegas.  The flavors of the food are amazing.  Portions are big but perfect for sharing.  They have live music and it is perfect.  Not too loud and a great accompaniment to the meal.  I am an aircraft mechanic and I think the view of the runways is amazing. Double bonus!  The whole staff is amazing but I have to give an extra thumbs up to Mani!!

yco9l3QdzqB-M3wfi2jUZA.text: First time having Indian food, was a great first impression :) The lamb tikka masala was delicious

9i9LTyv0OHErMUwgE9TKag.text: Good food, beautiful view, good service....I've found my home for home cooking Indian food.

photos.caption: Photo of Pure Indian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

S_JieUJlwWlo6ZnUQR68aw.text: This was the first time we visited Pure and we were very impressed. The restaurant looks out at the airport, so the view of planes landing makes for a beautiful sight.  The food was delicious.  We had the chicken jalfrezzi and the lamb vindaloo.   Both the chicken and lamb were as tender as I can remember at an Indian restaurant and the sauces were also excellently prepared.  The garlic naan and the basmati rice (which comes with the entree) were also very flavorful.   Go there.  You won't be disappointed.

sft5xg38eMLggpHQ1GqIWw.text: We came here based on 4 star reviews and experienced Bad and insensitive service . Also several items were not available in the buffett .

uHIgKylT55JIDDlYJjK4KQ.text: Amazing service and food. Prashant shah was a great server; very tentative, always making sure we were always enjoying ourselves. We had the tandoori chicken and lamb curry with a side of garlic naan. The chicken was seasoned just right, not too salty with just enough tenderness and juiciness...a lot of tandoori that I've had in other Indian restaurants tend to be cooked too long. Same with the lame curry, seasoned just right. Definitely 5 stars and will be coming back.

aBLRn_W91qSlbTZXmzixAA.text: This place was ok. The entrees are very expensive and compared to the Indian places we've visited, the tikka masala and butter chicken were both very tomato flavored. Ketchup overload. The rice was good, the lentil soup was good. The view is AMAZING. We got to watch plans land and take off and my kids were in heaven. You can see the lights from the strip at night too.

7h7vkAKI4064z3nNWijs9w.text: Delicious food, phenomenal service, decent wine selection.  Will make this a regular stop.

7qeerNIxuHa_FYeYACM0Mg.text: The food was really good. The view was great and made for a nice atmosphere. The service was awesome! Thanks to the exceptionally friendly staff!

tUuw80_mqFmqY1kpheL3fw.text: This place rocks... Cannot say enough good things about the food. Mani is a great host and always goes the extra mile to ensure food and customer experience is A++. I cook Indian food so giving this place 5 stars take the extra mile from me!!!

xMDUpZidxCNbPHx21c-GvQ.text: I came here recently with a group for a birthday luncheon. The buffet is a steal at $10 per person. It includes various types of curries, salads, meat dishes, and rice. I would highly recommend trying the garlic na'an or the butter chicken. That being said, my stomach didn't agree with the food, and other members of my group expressed a similar sentiment. The customer service, however was great, which is why I give this restaurant 3 stars.

DzCUZXi3iq1U4nQfMJt2nQ.text: First time visit to this restaurant. Empty at first, 6:00 on a Saturday night but filled up by time we left. Several tables that appeared to be Indian patrons,good sign.  We are not very experienced in this type of food, but it was the best Indian food we have had to date.  Ordered Chicken Pakora appetizer, Mulligatowny soup, very spicy, tomato soup, Chicken Tandoori, Lamb Tikka Masala and Shrimp Korma. Food served with basmati rice. Every dish was hot, spiced to taste, fresh and delicious.  The Mulligtowny soup and the lamb were outstanding! Plan to try the noon buffet soon. We will definitely be back.

PVd03Pd2tBvYUO8EdnZpLQ.text: Delicious Indian food!  The buffet is only $10.99 during the week and  $12.99 during the weekend (you get a drink with your meal on the weekend).    You get your choice of fresh regular or garlic naan to go along with your food.  Garlic naan is my favorite!

WYZnNUqHZCqsBK9jqEfzvg.text: First time at pure Indian Cuisine and had a great time with wonderful helpers. Mani was a very polite person and the rest of his crew, Aunty who cooks the num bread from scratch, makes a delicious meal for us. This place is the best place to eat at and provides a $100 view of the strip. :)

kq-lqrbjISkmLwEEbCJKeA.text: Our view was spectacular of the Las Vegas strip night lights...This is my first time, the food and service excellent... Highly Recommended, our server Mani was very helpful, and assisted in made some delicious entree suggestion, and we got to meet "Aunty", who made our fresh delicious Naan.

RIM86pTf6vuAGsAQ5ortAg.text: Was in Vegas and had lunch here. I was skeptical entering the building and walking upstairs but all that changed once I started to eat . The food was fresh and very clean and tasty and good service! Kudos!  We told the ladies and the gentleman there behind the counter the same thing Good food, great place and an awesome view!!!

gltAh1hBsL27jz8L8U9IyQ.text: I went here to try the buffet. The food was okay. The only thing I really enjoyed was the view and the garlic Naan. Otherwise, the food tasted average. Price was good and so was the service. I probably wouldn't dine here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Pure Indian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

syKtxJRhyGWOpPTLhOuK4Q.text: This place is amazing. It is hidden on the second floor of a building that has a kabob place on the bottom floor. You take an elevator to the second floor and the restaurant faces the airport. It is very gorgeous at night as you can see the strip and the planes landing and taking off. Our waitress Nikita was amazing and her service was on point. The food is cheaply priced, but the quality is amazing. We began with the pakora and the samosa chat and they were delicious. The garlic cheese naan was just perfect. For the main course we had a lamb dish and a birayani rice with shirt and it was probably the best I've had here in Vegas. I definitely recommend this place and will be coming back soon. Thank you Nikita for being extremely attentive.

yYL9rAVkkqRNS-hmvbK7Fg.text: Food is best Indian in town!  Mark is great and always smiling.  Great service and view!  The keyboard player makes the ambiance exceptional!  My new favorite spot! Watch the planes land!!

GSxX7PYbo8xGtHAVw_tOAA.text: Was looking for a decent Indian restaurant in Vegas and this restaurant did not disappoint me at all. Amazing food and not to miss the entrees! Feels home-like.

ULQ_HgRw5guLWmleIkXwww.text: Mani was such a pleasure. The restaurant was immaculate. Service was on point. The food was great. And the view was beautiful. Thank you, Mani, for a great experience.

DciGKBjnE7dsLW2JjhvgLA.text: Other reviews were right the food was very good, but the service was not up to par!   My server was the bus girl, she could not answer question about which dish was what!  It was not that busy for a bus person to wait on us!  The service was very slow we came in before a party of 8 and were served 15 mins after they were served.

_ZPVsrzO6EAD2yQG3CeDzA.text: The food is good for the most part. My only complaint is that they take too long to bring the nan bread by the time you are done with the first plate the bread comes.

AOtemBTnPqXslA9n3np70Q.text: Don't like Indian food so much ,But this restaurant makes me rethink about to start love it .High quality food ,Not too spicy if you request it.

jpmZc8uyCi0D4qX3f7NWuQ.text: Great food.  Great service.  Great view and location.  Come check it out and ask for Meni to be your server.  Definitely will be back.

B6tHDly5xS0PX3kQiSymyg.text: I AM IN LOVE WITH THIS PLACE!!! We picked this place at first because of the amazing reviews. When we walked in and we were treated pleasantly. We had amazing service throughout our time there and amazing staff.  THE FOOD IS OUTSTANDING!!!!! Let me repeat... OUTSTANDING!!!!!!!! The scenery is fantastic as well might I add! With a beautiful skyline of Vegas.

xn_Q6W6wSMdoaRuFtySS0Q.text: Excellent Indian food. Even though it's little far from the strip, it was totally worth it.

oK5yafsiB36madJLAyB8Fg.text: We came here for a buffet. The food was bad. One star was for the service.Avoid this if your expecting good  food . The food doesn't make up the price.worst food in recent times.

4xb5-0JaoHItiEKQh6LGOQ.text: Naan was homemade and amazing! Recommend paneer tikka masala and veggie samosa. Lunch buffet is a great deal, too. Amazing view, friendly staff, delicious food!

u_sjunvJrzarIqqBR7VaZg.text: Excellent Indian Food with great service!   We love this restaurant ever since our parents started coming here and brought us for a special treat!  The food is so delicious and fresh with very complex and rich east indian flavors.   We have had a wide range of dishes from curries to the tandoori to veggie to desserts!   We love the view of the planes taking off and landing from the big picture windows, but most of all we love the service!  Manny is a excellent manager and server, keeping a tight ship running and always having the time to make all the guests feel like the family.   My family is always happy to spend a evening here, with his efficient and warm service and of course great cuisine!   Oh did i mention live sitar music!!!

pd6FRT_QjZbppZQEnceuxQ.text: Awesome friendly great service and open late for all the graveyard people in this town...also great view of airplanes coming and going..

y8kY7bpKVhhfZVG8rIjYaQ.text: First time here. I was put off by the lack of maintenance in the building and elevator. They also need better signage.  But WOW the food was sooo good! I ordered palak paneer to share with my family while they each ordered another dish to share. I can't remember all the dish names, lol, but this is the first time ever that my whole family liked everything that was ordered. Service was also good. We will definitely come back.

aU6tF4eJITwmDl6eg1YQIA.text: If you haven't yet tried indian food then let this be your first. A hidden jem on Sunset which is a great time to vist with some of the best views of the strip. Another great meal. Mani was extremely friendly and atentative.  Oh and I can't miss out the live music it really adds to the atmosphere.

photos.caption: Photo of Pure Indian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Pure Indian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IzYD3xKIT3OIbk1ImAfL2w.text: I wish I could give lesser stars. I was in Vegas last night and craved for Indian food and trusting my Yelp brethren,  I went ahead to Pure Indian cusine. I cannot stress enough my disappointment .  They asked for spice levels and we ordered our food spicy. The biriyani  was absolutely  bland. The chilly chicken was smothered with tomato ketchup making it terribly tangy. The garlic naan was soft but again had no taste of garlic to it. At last we ordered ras malai, which again was not very savory. I have no idea how they have managed these stars. I sure caught them on a bad night!

mr0wwy_3N5frs5mHhpQn_A.text: Disappointed with the Butter Chicken, there is more flavor in the frozen dish you can buy  from Trader Joe's, also the quantity I received for 16 dollars was insufficient. The Dal soup was bland and somewhat sad compared to what I've eaten before. My appetizer and Mango Lassi were good but sad to say if I'm buying, I would not eat here again.

photos.caption: Photo of Pure Indian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. that is a nickel, not a quarter - this amount of butter chicken for 16 dollars?!

2AfbEz0QvVCxcrSLcYfgrQ.text: Hands down to the best indian food in las vegas... when u get to bite that chicken tikka masala with the aromatic garlic naan and add the breath taking view, u feel u are right in heaven..i would highly recommend this place to everyone...plus ask for mani and u will be willing to come back every other day...

9DGds5fXy4UJyVf5JtoN9A.text: Absolutely delicious! We just dined here for the second time and both times were amazing! Nikita took great care of us both times, excellent service! And Mani too - they both remembered us from our first visit :)   The view is great overlooking the strip, watching the airplanes fly in and out, especially at sunset    Plenty of Vegan options! Highly recommend the channa masala, vegetable pakora, samosa chat, vegetable samosa & lasoni gobi :) I wish I took pictures!

Fog77cqAkP0WnYrmOZJHgw.text: The food here is very good, and the view of the airport and Strip beyond is entertaining. The lunch buffet is a great value and an opportunity to try everything without having to know the names. At dinner service is spotty, and the wait staff aren't particularly friendly. If you use a Groupon (not good for the buffet) be sure to read the rules. They will try to make you order more than you are required by Groupon.

uKrxHWBUJHyyKHlAAZnnYg.text: Food was amazing and Mani was so helpful great views  Mixed grill was delicious Saag was great

7zVbAGSpzXf9OhSqOfK1fg.text: I have a pretty strong stomach, I've traveled overseas, I've ATE THE STREET FOOD, and since eating here I haven't taken a solid shit in 3 days.

loqe-1HgGPo_pYtB9yZO7g.text: Delicious food which is the main great thing, but the view is awesome too! All of the food is consistently delicious and the service on point. Everything has great flavors and the rice is tasty. Hope to be back in the future!

RtifFhjGL_RyisqDZv3Exw.text: Beyond unprofessional!! Ordered pickup today. Was told through email and Yelp it would be ready in 10-35 minutes. Sent my son to pick our two meals up which totals $36.00. He went in and told them that we had a to go order to pick up and the man rudely told him to cancel the order that they wasn't going to fill it!? My son being the shy person he is didn't question it and called me as he left but what the hell kind of business is this?! If you aren't fulfilling my order then call me and don't waste my time! HORRIBLE service!!!

hdxRiJK7_XiRl6iFjXIpqA.text: Definitely one of the best Ive ever had! Been over 25 yrs sincr Ive been to the Middle East and this brought me back! Heres the rundown. Naan bread w garlic is done to perfection,  soft hot and the finished edges done jist right! The buffet had a wonderful selection, several vegetarian items. Tandoori chicken had amazing flavor and by far best butter chicken out west. Curry goat was amazing and rice were exceptional. To top it off the runway views are awesome.   We live 120 miles away and when we come back to Vegas we will return!

2FTf_Z1kbb10b1NokPGlaQ.text: This place is AMAZING! The food is down right THE BEST Indian food I've ever tasted. There's   AWESOME views of the McCarran airport landing strip & the Las Vegas Strip. A+

_wcBXSDrrwuPqnvM3e_fgg.text: Great food and atmosphere! We had the chicken Tikka appetizer, chicken vindaloo and chicken Tikka masala main course. All were amazing. The live music was fantastic! Fleetwood Mac, Journey, Led Zeppelin, etc! The bongo player was excellent! Her beautiful voice! Across from the airport to watch the planes land and take off! A must try!

Nb0J3uAAWbxn2n3vxAA4oA.text: There are few times in life when food is so perfectly cooked and served. I would give 5 out of 5 for the taste and presentation. Staff is very friendly and quick. I would definitely recommend this place if you are in town and want to taste some quality Indian food.

_fIfVJfIwpuRksOML1-AXA.text: My boyfriend and I drive past this place often and decided to go in one freezing night and I don't regret it. The staff were very attentive, the hookah was smooth, the food was delicious, and the drinks was a bit strong so you will get your money's worth off just one lol. For the food we had fries, lamb chops, and hot wings (all 3 were cooked to perfection). Oh yes and I can't forget about the incredible view as we dined like a queen and king. No complaints!

S2XioldclhEKAkmFdX3f8w.text: Worst food I ever ate so far in Vegas. All the vegetarian dishes sucks. Sambar (Yesterday's I believe) is sour, mango custard  is awful (Yesterday's I believe) there's water on top of it and it tasted sour. Mushroom curry was a big disaster. You eat and you feel like sour. Rice is dry AF. I have decided never to visit again. The one star I gave is coz of the Runway view. Just avoid if you can.

yIJDST6StxE0rdchtYxe9g.text: Great place the food is awesome and the prices unbeatable i was really happily surprised try the chicken tandori and the lamb tika masala with some cheese naan

LpIMj1wBNe6YTZ0vLGXV1w.text: Awesome place to be. Love coming here for the food,view and hookah. Everyone is so friendly and nice always welcoming. Have never been dissaponted. Must try my favorite the butter chicken with nan, to die for. My number one place recomend it to anyone .

pYLdO9K1zICR_s55VTOoxQ.text: From out of town and was looking for good Indian food. Scored with this place. Manny and Natalie were THE BEST. Food was fresh and delicious. Chicken Tikka Masala was some of the best I've ever had. They even learned it was my birthday and brought me cake. So friendly, so delicious. We will definitely be back next time we are in town.

hoTHCJf3Iqmf8vpxg8t3lQ.text: The ambiance, view, singer and service were exceptional. The quality, temperature, flavor, toughness of the meat and value of the food was slightly below average but we are from SF where ethnic food is great. We used a promotional offer which made it a good deal. There is a parking garage underneath and you need to use it or some guy outside in the strip mall will make you re-park.

mPjkFp9sxwqaEiZ4TnG4oQ.text: This place is AWESOME! We love us some Indian buffet but this place comes with a view too! We will definitely be back for some samosas. Btw Nikita is great, too

a0Q0GhIAF8XB0EjyfWbJLg.text: This is a wonderful Indian restaurant that we had dinner at on our last trip to Las Vegas.  The service was a little slow but the employees were attentive when they were bringing your items to you.  The food was delicious.  I must say as someone that frequently has stomach issues eating unfamiliar food, their food did not do that to me at all so that is a huge plus!  I had something that was curry as I usually in an Indian restaurant. My husband had a smoothie like beverage and said it was very good.   As someone with an avid interest in aviation, being located with an end to end view of the Las Vegas airport's runway was a great treat as I was watching it during the meal. The restaurant is located adjacent to a hookah lounge and parking is limited and we had to go underground into the parking for the building which is similar to an office building.  We plan to return on a future visit so that may be the best sign of it being a good place to check out.

oisv-i4mBo7b-aM5IP95kA.text: This place is phenomenal! It features some of the best curries and paneer dishes I've ever had. It is definitely a notch above your average Indian restaurant!! They have a gorgeous view of the Vegas skyline and big windows to enjoy the views and watch airplanes take off and land. The restaurant is well appointed with classy, modern fixtures. They also have top notch entertainment on the weekends. I was so impressed with this place, I feel fortunate to live nearby.

xosfb5IwV4mDlMZCicq13Q.text: Best Indian restaurant in town. Food is exquisite and service is impeccable. Highly satisfied with food and service. My table was attended by two preety girls. I guess their name was Nikita and Kriti. They are doing best job. Highly appreciated! Will be back soon.

H97BsszuhmldrXaL5HdO-A.text: Amazing service, even better food. Must visit for authentic Indian food & ambience. They have live music and an amazing view of the airport and the strip.

WTZ5sgpkI1Zlg6euoev8CQ.text: The food was a tiny bit pricey (but we had a Groupon so it didn't matter) and the drinks were awful light, but otherwise have no complaints. The service was great. Food was excellent. Good, solid Punjabi style Indian food. Would definitely go back.

P5wBDpuR3qHaMTZEVl2-rg.text: Tonight we ordered the butter chicken, garlic naan and vegetarian Saag. We were here two times before and just as we had enjoyed those first two times we enjoyed the third time here as well. The food has excellent flavor and the service is excellent. The portions are generous and we are already looking forward to the leftovers tomorrow. The location is a very special spot being right across from the airport and watching the planes come in and go out. A great place to visit for tourists and locals alike.

AXY3S001ek5wmnFeoZAZbQ.text: Very awesome Indian food, I don't really eat Indian food but everything i have had here is delicious!  Mani is an excellent server!!! Very good staff, very good service, very nice restaurant,definitely a must try

VuPlyJwqJovFlpnig1aRnQ.text: Yummy food, cool ambience with a great view of planes landing. Try the saffron and peach cocktail.

1z093plv_iKHY5mJ_ZuofA.text: I wanted to thank you again for such a wonderful service and food!!! friends are still talking about how great everything was and how fun it was too. and we got the wonderful environment from employees as well.nikita n kriti keep it up.....

TprPz1v-edgdAjwAnC-LdQ.text: Great food and friendly service! We had the butter chicken, chicken tikka, garlic naan, and some yogurt dish.  The butter chicken was the best I've ever had! There's liver entertainment Friday night too.  I will definitely be back!

mDwxlrJhJEpXJVbSCXyCCg.text: Went late night with my girlfriend for some lamb and chicken vindaloo. Both were prepared perfectly and so was the garlic naan. Great draft beers and an amazing view this might have to be one of my new regular spots in Vegas! 5/5

8ii_ANb1i3bhxZndZM07Pw.text: Came here for my birthday last night. The food and service was incredible... tastes like new york!

vPU_4RTfc8jtHI_xIGQ_pQ.text: Food was good. There wasn't much exciting about it. I'm used to eating Indian food with lots of flavor with a party in my mouth but this felt more like a slow dance. Was good but not great.

A2SEAEdX-PXsDbabFkb5Dw.text: Maybe just the one dish but I ordered butter chicken "spicy". There was zero spice at all! I enjoy spicy food and this had nothing. If you like very generic Indian food that is safe for everyone to try then this is your place.

_-uGRnKjZVjhCigIIdmUTw.text: Oh man! I missed the lunch buffet but the dinner menu did not disappoint! Easily the best Mixed Vegetable Curry I've had in a very long time - colorful and tender ingredients with a refreshing made-to-order vibe. So good! Palak Paneer was savory and delicious, as was the Dal Tadka. I got every dish 7/10 on the hot (spice) scale. I could've done 5 or 6 and it still would've been sufficiently spicy. Dinner portions are generous, which is nice because you *will* want leftovers.  Looking forward to trying the lunch buffet before/after my next mid-day flight at McCarran.  Mint and Mt. Everest have some serious competition in Pure! For the last couple of years, I've been declaring Mint as the best Indian in the city, now I'm definitely not so sure. Pure could very well be the hands down best in town!

b33ehzkbG3vmC2hFm1s3DQ.text: I LOVE THIS PLACE. This is the first place I tried Indian cuisine and was over the moon about it! I can't believe I went 26 years without these divine flavors in my life.   My office is just around the corner from here so my coworkers and I often come here for the $11.99 lunch buffet. They put the menu up on their Facebook page so you know what they're serving that day before you show up.   The view of the airport and strip is gorgeous and they sometimes have live music that's pretty decent!   Their butter chicken is amazing and garlic naan is to die for! Service is absolutely exceptional every time. Definitely check this place out!

-Mj2qWF3XGIdWEL7N-1sLg.text: Came in with friends. Food is okay not too bad but The management is ridiculous. And the boss mistreats the workers! And if you're planning to tip DONT! The workers don't see any of it. The boss just sat and drank with his friends on top of that, he keeps the tips that where meant for the workers! I will not be supporting a business like this. I wish I could give two separate ratings. One for the management and one for the workers who actually bust there ass off. Negative stars for management. 5 for the workers. Mainly one short Mexican one who was actually working while the others stood around.

XQxQLErh_p05iAHpOjz3Xg.text: The food here was mediocre. The cashew base curry was delicious but the vegetable curry was below standard. We ordered the garlic and onion naan and they were quite small pieces versus what you can get at another restaurant.   The server was nice, meaning he did what he had to do, but he was unhappy with his life, never smiled or make us feel welcome.   The best thing is the view. I'd rather buy food elsewhere and enjoy the view by sitting outside next to the airport.

FCDDE8ID8cRX8FHRbzOZWw.text: I cannot speak highly enough of this place! Food was fantastic and I loved how genuinely nice and attentive all the staff members were! Looking forward to our next visit already!

KKqM-DGrlse-w7n1q0AQpw.text: Amazing food and service! We ordered off the menu and each dish was better than the last. IBRmozGL7KqlGGb0k8vHZg.text: I went here for lunch today and all I gotta say if that it was bomb!!!  So why the 4 stars? I minused one because the ladies bathroom was in very sad shape. There were 3 stalls and all three were filthy and no toilet paper....:(  Now onto the nitty gritty....:)  Ambiance was very nice. The restaurant was clean and the tables were set up nicely and the view of the planes taking off and landing was great. The only drawback is the location. The entrance for the restaurant is on the side of the building and the restaurant is upstairs.  There really are no signs pointing to where the restaurant is located. So as soon as u enter.... U see a small lobby with stairs to your left right next to an elevator. But no signs as to if the restaurant is upstairs. Go upstairs!! :). When u go upstairs u will see some red signs saying restaurant and lounge and for the life of me I can't remember the third sign....:( follow the hallway under the red restaurant sign and u will start to smell the deliciousness!!! Follow your nose!! :) (4/5)   Service was impeccable! There was only one large table of 6 ppl when I entered. I was told that I could sit wherever I wanted so I chose a booth and I was served with water and iced tea and mango lassi which were the drinks that I ordered. :) the ice tea and water were your run of the mill.... But mango lassi was delicious! Perfectly creamy with just a hint of the yogurt and just perfect for putting out some of the heat from the dishes. My water glass/tea were constantly filled and they came and touched my table constantly to make sure I was good. (5/5)  Food.... They had a great selection of sauces.... I'm normally not big onto the sauces but I saw a green sauce that reminded me of this salsa Verde I had back home in Texas... Of course it did not taste like what I remembered but the green sauce was delicious nonetheless! It had chilis, mint and cumin I think.... All I can say was that I just wanted to eat it up... So good with the vegetable samosas....I just didn't want to stop. Lol. I skipped some dishes like the rice and the French fries. Why load up on carbs when there were so many other flavorful carbs like naan coming your way.... Puhahaha  The saag paneer was done right. So flavorful and so balanced. It was delicious!!! The chicken tandoori I did not touch as there was a customer there before that kept on going back to the buffet line with a half full dish and that's what he was grabbing and it looked like he had touched the tongs to his plate of half full food.... I couldn't be sure but I wasn't going to touch it. I wished the staff working there would have said something about using a new plate every time. I guess I figured that everyone knew not to bring an old plate but just to grab a new one??? I'm guessing not. :/ I digress.... Back onto the food...  They had salad which I skipped... For obvious reasons as there were more flavorful things waiting for me. :) there was another curry dish with chickpeas in it... Forgot the name but it was good as well. The chilli chicken was very tender and full bodied and delicious. The butter chicken like the name implies was like "butta"... Very very tender almost melt in your mouth deliciousness!!  But my all time favorite dish was the coconut potato and to think that I almost passed this one by. The coconut flavor balanced out the curry flavor... It was so creamy and yummy!!  Overall my impression was that they are trying very hard to please and the good speaks for itself. The chef came out of the kitchen to check on the food a couple of times as I was eating there...I appreciate that. :)  Will I be back? Heck yeah!!! :) I can't wait to come back and try the dinner.

mEvLq0rohYR423solimKxA.text: I came to eat here on my birthday and I was so happy that I did. Thanks to yelp I was able to find it because It's sort of hidden . DzyPXaTQOWVuUQybB51hkA.text: This is a one star because there is a stocky build guy who works the dining room and does not care about food allergies at all.  To him it's nothing more then a big joke.  My wife likes the food here, the few times prior to this visit the food for me was good as well.  Normally we've had one of the female servers who do listen to customer needs and made sure the kitchen made my food properly.  On this visit however, after several dishes were served to include the rice and we started eating, I immediately noticed an issue.  We called the waiter over and asked him if there was cinnamon in the rice and/or anything else?  He said yes.  Really??? Cinnamon in jasmine rice as well as other dishes?  We all looked at him in disbelief stating we told you there was a cinnamon allergy.  His response?  You've been here before for the lunch Buffett, did you eat the rice and other stuff that time?  Really?  You don't deserve to be working here.  Our response...we asked what dishes on the Buffett had cinnamon that day and they took the time to ask the chef.  As I was headed out the door to try and get medicine to counter act the allergy, I noticed the girl staff yelling at him for not checking and taking this seriously.  It was a very rough night that came very close to the ER.  He's lucky he's not facing a law suit, he was just rude and did not care.  My wife says he seemed to feel bad and took 10% off the bill and gave her free desert, really?  My wife likes the food here and it's good for her dietary needs so I will take her back if she so desires however, I will NEVER eat here again as I do not feel I can trust this place to take food allergies seriously.  Luck of the draw on servers does not work for me.

fmj4CMdB3moDdMv5NxIS0w.text: Food quality went down significantly for the lunch buffet. They have now less number of dishes with most entries seemed to be cooked over and over. JIJut64LDN4RudVESkqslQ.text: Surprising little gem!   Walking into the downstairs of the building, you wouldn't guess what you're going to find in the upstairs. It's kind of shady feeling, and normally I'd have taken one sniff of the lingering cigarette smoke and walked out. However (and thankfully), once we made it upstairs and figured out that it was NOT in the hookah place next door, it was quite a relief to see an airy, clean restaurant space to walk into.   There are big windows where you can watch the planes take off and land while you have your meal, and enjoy the sun (or lights).   The food. Yes, the food. Definitely some of the best we've had in the city, especially for a very reasonable $12.00 lunch buffet.   The salad fare was standard stuff. I wish I'd taken pics of the rest of the buffet, but I was too damn hungry to remember..LOL.   After taking our drink orders, the waitress brought a combination basket of plain and garlic naan to the table, that was obviously right out of the oven. It was thicker/more doughy than I personally prefer, but still very good. I like it thinner so I don't fill up so easily, and also to sop up the sauces better.  The palak paneer and butter chicken were the standouts for us. Perfectly creamy and lots of flavor. The spinach was slightly spicy, just the way it should be.  The vegetable korma was also well flavored and not bland. The chicken tikka was rather dry, but the fresh batch they brought out was just fine.   There were a couple of other chicken dishes that were tasty as well, but my favorite dish hands down was the curried goat. Lots of flavor layers and decent chunks of meat amongst all of the little bones. (why there always are so many in goat meat, I have no idea...I don't recall seeing micro goats with micro bones everywhere..lol). That was really that only purpose for me to have any rice at all on my plate...just so I wouldn't lose that yummy sauce!   Service overall was pleasant. Our water glasses were kept full, though we did have to ask for more naan, and it wasn't busy when we were eating.   The rice pudding was good, nothing unusual though. The mango "custard" was very sweet, cloyingly so for me. I'd never had it before, and a woman diner warned me about the sugar and how it was more to be used in small amounts, like a dip . It was not custard like at all in presentation, more like a somewhat thin pudding consistency. Maybe that's standard, I don't know, but just throwing the discrepancy out there.   Anyway, we found the place to be worthy of a review, and we will definitely return once I can risk the million calories again :-)  **UPDATE**:  Upon making a second trip here, I have to say I'm pretty disappointed. The quality of the first visit just wasn't there this time, and so, I'll likely continue going to Mt. Everest instead as they are quite consistent, and very accommodating there. My initial review was 4 stars here, and I've adjusted it down to 3.

2nx3RlnxvkcMUmTLpnCl8g.text: Beware! I've eaten here twice. The first time (a few weeks ago), the food was above average and the service was ok. Prices were a little high, but the food was good enough that I didnt mind. This time my friend and I both got really sick after. Having not eaten anything else, I know for a fact that it made us sick. On top of that we had ordered enough to have leftovers so now I have to throw away 2/3 of a meal that cost $70+. They also kind of ignored us when we came in, in favor of talking to people that seemed to be personal friends.

HxdwyAEzEy0Xo5LqIoPklw.text: I've ordered from them 3 times now. Every time it's delivered earlier than expected. Really hot and delicious. Medium spice is a True medium. Very flavorful. Better than most options around.

Our server was Alex, the manager, who was very friendly and attentive and after asking me what my preferences as far as spice levels go, suggested the chana but instead of masala, in a korma sauce. The restaurant was empty upon arrival but I noticed as it started getting dark outside, the restaurant became full. The view of the airport and the strip makes it a very positive experience. We ordered kabuli naan which is a sweet naan but worked so well with the spicy and salty food. My dinner date ordered lamb tikka masala and I ordered chana korma. The flavor and spice Ievel of the korma was outstanding but a little too salty for my tastebuds. My dinner date said his dish was tasty but the lamb tasted like beef. I have been wanting to try this place for some time now and foresee a return visit in the near future.

M9uQ3fdGUnBqBjFGtP-vdQ.text: When a restaurant features a view of planes landing, who else do you take but your flight attendant friend? Watching her geek out over the planes was almost as good as the food itself. The restaurant-bar-lounge is somewhat hidden in the second floor of a business park, but well worth seeking out if you enjoy Indian cuisine.  Their menu is expansive, opt for something beyond Butter Chicken and Tandoori dishes- though they likely do those just as well. We shared the Lamb Rogan Josh and Shrimp Saag entrees, with basmati rice and garlic naan. Dishes were amply portioned with flavorful sauces and a nice heat, and the proteins were fresh and juicy. If you enjoy the kick, upgrade to spicy!    The service for dinner seemed overwhelmed even before they got busy, with items forgotten, check errors, and a delay receiving our food. That said, I would come back for their lunch buffet ($12/pp?) to try more of their dishes before returning for a dinner. Good date night spot for the food quality and views!

Ph7tJIBVo49TqlOFmq-J6A.text: This is by far the best Indian cuisine I have every tried!!!!! AND I have tried different Indian places in chicago, in little India. This place is better!!! OVsft0uZ7PAnfMnhyc2vvQ.text: Dinner experience.** In my opinion, the portions were small and the price was high. $17 for maybe 10 pieces of meat in the chicken tikka masala. They also gave us 2 plates of rice for 3 entrees.   The service started off ok, but towards the end we were neglected. There was a Yelp coupon for a "free samosas with the purchase of 2 entrees", we were unable to click on the coupon from an Android and iPhone so the waiter took this opportunity to ignore the deal. When we showed him that it wasn't pulling up, he said he would look into it. He never did...   We were a party of 3 adults and 3 toddlers (2 year olds). The toddlers didn't order any additional food from their menu, SO I guess they made up for the lost revenue by adding a 15% (large party) gratuity to our bill. I had added a take out order to my bill and the 15% was added to the take out order.   This place was good, but I would probably not go back. The way that they handle business really turned me away.

MwzT-wUG5R9Q4q2oDsWTkg.text: This is my favorite Indian buffet in Vegas. The food is always fresh and absolutely delicious. The staff is friendly. Restaurant is clean and beautiful. Besides the food being sooooo good, the view of the airport adds a special something to the place. We always sit by the window and watch the planes take off and land. It's so much fun to watch! And then I quiz my bf on airplane trivia.  Great food, great atmosphere! Great staff! Great view!  What more could you ask for? 5 stars!

photos.caption: Photo of Pure Indian Cuisine - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful restaurant. Great buffet. One of my favorites!

plUPMpct8xUFXMngeDH3rA.text: Delicious food! Went during lunch and they were so nice! Their naan bread is so so good! It's light and crispy and everything there was delicious!

P0hQjMugH3ak5gGseGcIuA.text: Okay, the fact that this restaurant is located across from the airport on the second floor allows for pretty nice views -- the Strip skyline in the distance peppered periodically with planes making their descent into Vegas. I'll round up a star for that alone. You can ponder the logistics of aviation while waiting for your complimentary papadum and chutney. (The minty green sauce is better than the red.)  The entrance is a little odd. You walk in through some double doors, either take the elevator or stairs, pass the hookah lounge, and make a turn at the long hallway. We went on a Sunday evening. There were about two other tables there. One of them consisted of tourists, clad in Vegas memorabilia, and the other was an Indian family, so that's a good sign.   I got the PALAK PANEER ($14) while my dad got the LAMB KARAHI ($16). Both came with Basmati rice, but it was merged onto one plate (could've used another scoop or so). We also got an order of the garlic naan, but it was served kind of cold. My entree was the palak paneer, which is my favorite Indian dish. I barely ate a third of it and got full. No one thinks you can get full off of pureed spinach and cheese cubes, but those spices and seasonings do their job of pumping up the flavor. I didn't try the lamb because I'm not a fan of gamey meats, but my dad said it was good. So there you go.  Service was mediocre. Our two waiters didn't seem too friendly. Also, it was Easter and so I called ahead to make sure I could use my Groupon and the lady had said yes. When I tried to redeem it, one of the waiters was adamant in declining it. (In fine print, it states not valid on federal holidays, but Easter isn't a federal holiday.) He replied that he had not been accepting them all day. Well, I guess those grouponers got swindled. He ended up redeeming mine after I explained I had called in to check. There was a lady bussing tables that day and she was the friendliest out of all them.  Overall, Pure Indian Cuisine has a great location/view, worth checking out with the Groupon. I'd stop by again, but it's not my favorite. There are plenty of Indian restaurants in the city deservedly vying for your visit.

rXTnV87ahYsukR6BUQebYw.text: Every once in a while I have a hankering for Indian food.  My usual place is out of the way with horrendous parking.  Pure Indian Cuisine is easy to locate with plenty of parking.  It may seem strange when walking into the entrance but just go up to the second level and follow the signs.  A long little hallway leads you back to the dining room and bar.  Windows span the restaurant which gives you a great view of the planes landing. The view is outstanding!  Of course I am a bit biased if you know what my husband does for a living.   We came here for their lunch buffet.  With Indian food I always enjoy a variety on my plate.  Their buffet has good offerings from soups, salad, vegetarian and traditional.  Unfortunately I am really bad about the names of their dishes but the intense flavors of each selection really hit every taste bud.  Of course they bring out a basket garlic naan bread which was inhaled immediately.    The service here was welcoming and very attentive.  With good service and good food, there wouldn't be a hesitation to come back.

drjk2kZHsvDsc4elVA8ztA.text: Review for garlic naan chicken tikka navaratna korma and samosa Bit expensive for Indian food? Because it's on the strip? Entree items run up from 15 and up but it tastes pretty good and how Indian food usually taste like. For locals better off avoiding the hassle of the strip traffic. If ur on the strip already this place is way better than urban turban which stinks

RrEHbkoV5_znD6QtQj5GJg.text: Awesome view of the air planes and the best Indian food in all of Las Vegas! Thank you sooo much for a great time and warm meal! The service was fantastic too! I was very impressed that the spicy level 7 was actually perfectly spiced for my meal-

Dfm_Xs64acaInSnvVE5ATA.text: Excellent food, great customer service, and a view to kill for!   Being an East Indian and having grown up on North Indian food, I can vouch for some of the 'cool' menu items like Lasooni Gobi, their veg fritters are really authentic.   Mani takes special interest in his guests. He is the most experienced of their staff and knows his way around the best dishes. He is focused on impressing his customers which is always good!   Very amiable and warm customer service!   A definite 5 star!

rK4Wqa1jT4xH4olK-FtwCg.text: We bought the chicken tikka,lamb roganjosh,mutter paneer and my gosh,everything was lip smacking and it was a great place for dine in plus the view it adds onto the food so I would give this place a 5 star rating for their wonderful service,excellent food and mind blowing ambience the wait staff are just on their toes for their delivery in service from the moment you enter leaving you with a smile on your face until you get back home.Thanks to Mani and Rohan for being there for the assistance with their best selling entrees and appetizers. Thank you Pure Indian Cuisine for this amazing experience! We will surely be returning back and recommend it to everyone wanting to try classy food!  Thank you.

On_2i8IQ0gII6RzenRP9eA.text: Fantastic food. Vegetable samosa was very good. Definitely going on my list of Las Vegas stops.

0H7jufNf9y382iwkP-2VrA.text: I love this place. Good Indian food, though possibly not quite the best in town. But it's still very well done. The service has always been good to me. I won't lie, I freaking love the view. Come in during the day so you can watch the planes taking off and landing at the airport.

mJbLiZyy1WUSqGZ_Jg8GKg.text: The food was great! The was a great view of the airport landing strip. There was a great live musician who did very well.

rSZK--ZU-0NnAgwb2nQ65g.text: Great food with good ambience and service. Highly recommend this place if you are visiting or in Vegas and one more good thing, it's open till 3 AM.

YIPnt9UTJuOBqh0rF2dnsg.text: Obviously, the view.  It was fine. I wouldn't get all crazy about this place. Service was good and it's cool that they identify what's vegan and what's not but I wasn't really impressed. Came for dinner, no idea what lunch buffet is like.

Y08YQPvrWF-7oGE1zPlSdA.text: Amazing food!  Truly authentic!  Customer service is amazing! Mani is the best manager! He knows how to service customers.

YMZt9IrVnaWxDD11F8Quuw.text: Great buffet with excellent view. My server name Money that's right Money. Need to come by on the evening.

Ewh0p4r3TzJL3AkElBhcwA.text: Overall unimpressed with Pure Indian Cuisine.   While the food was on par with any other Indian restaurant in town, the portion size and price did not adequately reflect the quality of the food. Indian food is a great lunch option mainly because of its price, size, variety, and healthiness. I ordered three dishes and three bottled waters for the whopping total of $80 (including tip).   That's.... pretty crazy for two paltry chicken dishes and mixed vegetables. Great food at exorbitant prices.

PbAoArKu-K8XS6hpjwMjjg.text: Loved the Briyani Lamb!  Curries were excellent too. Mani was wonderful and helpful in ordering. We loved the musician too -Miko Montgomery!

uEGeC79eDVeHtjtHlwfCeg.text: Goat curry , chicken tikka Masala very good. Good service. I like it airport view also very good.

6G-69g4UETlp-pc54d8vsQ.text: Came here for the lunch buffet which is $11.95/person I believe. Buffet has extensive options and there is a full bar. The restaurant reminds me of one from India, especially walking up the stairs and through the hallways, but it does have a pretty cool view of the airport's runways. The staff was a little scatter-brained and the food wasn't being refilled on time, but it was very tasty nonetheless. It'd be better if they included more options, like more desserts and chai in their buffet, but all in all, we'll be back. Parking was a little difficult because the lot got full, so you may have to go to the lot below the building.

RXzFzP9VBg_sunDIBniwIw.text: Great service, great food!  Manny and Natalia went out of their way to serve us. We will definitely be returning soon. The view is amazing and the ambience is just as good. We love this place!

rt9WGsBQXRYD6d2-6SdSFg.text: Good ambiance, excellent serving but taste of food is worst. We ordered veg curries he just dumped frozen packets and added masala. Indian cooking takes time but it more tasted like fast food with boiled vegetables and masala powder not cooked.

_Zzv93s_XtQpfICEh2EHIw.text: It took us a few tries to find this place (just look for the Kebob place and then head upstairs), but we're sure glad we did!  We've eaten some pretty great Indian food both in the UK and in the US, especially in the Chicago area where we live; Pure Indian was just as good as our favorite restaurants in more promising locations (right outside the Las Vegas airport didn't seem too auspicious).  The saag paneer and chicken tikka masala were both very flavorful, and the garlic naan was excellent.  The service was also stellar, with multiple servers checking on us regularly; if anything, they need to pull back a little on the number of times they ask to refill your water.  It turns out that an airport strip mall is in fact a great location for a restaurant, since you can sit at the window and have a great view of the Strip and of the planes taking off and landing at the airport.  Overall, this was a great experience, and we will most definitely be back if we return to Vegas!

5zg7NFQzPvd9jJJWa4xLug.text: Great spot!!!! I love that this place is on the 2nd floor and has a great view of the planes taking off and landing. The server was very mic and manager very attentive. We ordered the butter chicken and chicken tikka masala and shrimp masala and all at a mild temp. Next time I could go with a spicier temp. Samosa and garlic naan are also great. We will be back....can't wait to try lunch buffet

x8LEMIM96SSRPMtv0befUg.text: Very delicious food. Loved the buffet. Samosa's are small but super tasty. As a vegetarian Indian I can say they have good cook. Restaurant is neat and clean.

mwNha0OoABfEcu1SgE62Yw.text: Came here for $10.99 lunch buffet because I was in the area and they have good reviews on Yelp. This place is located in the back of "Fresh Kabob" which is facing Sunset Rd. It's on the second floor so you have to take the stairs or the elevator.  As soon as I walked in, I was wowed by the view of the runway with the plane taking off!! I was welcomed by the waitress, Nikita. She was nice and sweet. There are so many different curries in the buffet area. From vegetarian ones to chicken ones to lamb ones!! I tried everything and they were all delicious. The chicken was tender and flavorful. I liked "Navaratan Korma". It's cashew nuts pasted curry. Nice sweet taste but a bit spicy. It was delicious with their garlic naan.  I met a guy here that explained me about all of their vegetarian curries (How nice!). He said he's a vegetarian and he comes here every week. So, if you are a vegetarian and love Indian food, you still have a lot of choices you can eat at this place!! Vegetarian friendly. I'd love to come back here at night for the view!!

36tpKDmgEAnSrFjmuIAhGA.text: This is one of the best restaurant in vegas. All the vege dishes are very good. Deserets are good too. Good view of the airport.

_EtP8h_solutAuBapXsivg.text: Delicious! Went there for lunch today and I am one happy camper! There were all my favorite Indian dishes today.  The chef managed to make the dishes flavorful with a hint of heat without being overpowering. Bravo! I also took a coworker who had never had Indian food before and he loved it! A buffet was a large variety of vegetarian and meat dishes. I tried the channa masala, cabbage, spinach (saag paneer), aloo mattar( potato and pea curry), raita, samosas, tandoori chicken, and finally butter chicken, and they were all delicious ! Try it! You won't regret it!

MiLr6g6N4EEcTxkMhXLSFQ.text: The food was good. The service very average. We Asked for 2 beers and got two huge one (2 bottles in each). They should have informed us of the size.  The decor was very cafeteria like. Not sure I would go again.

qZXB2pMqcS_SgF1FzRSb9w.text: Let me start off by saying that we're Indian and eat Indian food on a regular basis. That being said, the food here is exceptional. The flavors were authentic and reminded me of the street food found in India. We tried both the vegetarian and non vegetarian food. (Malai kofta and chicken curry) We've already come here twice during our stay in Vegas and will definitely come next time we are in Vegas.

5_Esu74W61PhWGHW6pTaEg.text: We had another wonderful experience again! The service  is stellar  and the food is rich amd flavorful. We enjoy the many vegan options that they have available.  Nikita and  Mani are great assets to the restaurant and our overall experience.

xm1g-jdFmX9Ucl0M8Aieng.text: We were looking for good indian food in Vegas and chanced upon this. The food was fresh, piping hot and the naan was great. The view is quite different and kind of grows more on you. Watching planes take off and land with a view of the strip along with some tummy loving chicken tikka masala and garlic naan is sure to make heads turn. The owner is a really nice person and made us feel at home. Would be back here when we get to Vegas again.

VXLBHWL1EXAABZRKnAgZcQ.text: I just had their Weekend Champagne Buffet and it was Delicious. I was a little nervous because usually Indian cuisine is spicy however nothing was to spicy the selection of items they had out was perfect. The food was so good I couldn't  pick a favorite the window seating was perfect also. I look forward to having dinner there when they have live entertainment.

rLEK-FKcBxK7JCWsCKaoQw.text: This is one of the best Indian restaurant in Vegas... I went with the group of 5 and everyone was so happy with the food n service... Service was exceptionally good.. We would definitely be back

OZBG6iasCPddQiXBE--3iA.text: Great Indian food, a necessary stop on business trips to Vegas. Excellent food, excellent service (server Andres and the rest of their team). Don't consider any other Indian place in Vegas. Come here.

xQNIRFhwOUDbSdZiAbkMbw.text: Knowledgeable, entertaining, and friendly service. The shrimp curry and garlic nan break was delicious, and drink and food prices were very reasonable. The view of McCarren and the strip were picture perfect. I will return...

_2yf2e49ce0HAbWWyS05EA.text: Awesome place! We come here for the lunch buffet , which is affordable and has a lots of selections. Staff here is great. Mani, Nikita and Kriti were very kind and helpful. View of the airport here is amazing and probably much better at night.

am_ZTl14NadNktmeIISaug.text: We come to this restaurant almost every day for lunch. The buffet is excellent and reasonably priced. When it comes to Indian food,  it is in the spices that determines what is good.  The food here is not too hot and spicy,  a beautiful blend that is just right.  I would recommend their garlic nam and their rice pudding.

u9HdyNsamVOkWtbLqocS8g.text: This place is great. The chicken tikka masala was amazing and it came with naan and beautiful rice. The hookah was surprisingly well hitting and our server Mani was very courteous. The view is a nice touch, I would definitely come here again.

JktLXkVxeUg2lYBV0hYpEQ.text: Drove on from Cali before a red eye. Close to the airport. Best garlic naan ever. Chicken Tikka and Vindaloo were awesome. Service was great.

ht-27qtEgLgBC1KbEb2XxQ.text: Best Tika Masala I've ever had!! Kristi and carlos were our servers and they were both extremely nice!!! :)

u6Tw-jNMV7Cdsmuw4MAcVg.text: Food quality , taste is very authentic and delicious - loved the staff courtesy which is rare to find -

aSuH27ba_i6KpfUF2DT2pw.text: Having lived in India, this is the closest to authentic cuisine you can get, particularly here in Vegas.   The Chicken Tikka Mandala is excellent and the Naan is always hot.   The buffet is a great deal!

GRgJ3bkWE0deXBZiWWGXPg.text: This restaurant has wonderful food, service and ambiance. The view is great too. Enoyed the lunch buffet with family.

TKixL-Q3WM2J_sIha_D3qQ.text: Having a boyfriend who is extremely picky about his Indian food I am always double crossing all my fingers when trying a new place. Good news. We both love this place!! Great food and very attentive service. Manni was great and we felt very much like valued patrons. We came at sunset and enjoyed the great view of the strip. I highly recommend this not only to people who like Indian food but even those who are just looking to try it for the first time.

RdkQcQO2UX_YT1bqQNC5mQ.text: This restaurant is hands down one of my favorites here in LV. It serves delicious food and everything about the place is incredibly authentic - from the entertainment, to the decor, to the flavors of the food. The servers are so kind and cater to your every need. You have a great view of the airport runway while you're dining which is exciting for me and great for families. The entire experience at Pure Indian Cuisine is phenomenal.

J8UKHGkBRW8J-8RX9NZisg.text: Excellent food, friendly people, amazing view.... This is my new favorite Indian spot! P.S. Make sure you get the naan.

o53652mbTwWwChMteJaBSg.text: Lived in Las Vegas for 56 years. I've eaten at a lot of places. I was thrilled at how delicious this food is. The Menu is a bit hard to decipher but with the help of the charming waitress I decided on a Chicken curry dish with a buttery sauce (Chicken Tiki Marsala *not sure about the spelling.) WOW! Excellent portions, chicken was tender. I asked for spicy, it was not unpleasantly hot.  Lots of perfect rice. More then enough to take home left overs. We ate  at 4 pm, after the buffet had ended to avoid any rush. The restaurant is on the 2nd floor and over looks the airport runways with the Strip in the background. It's clean and pleasantly decorated with a full bar. We took our time and never felt rushed or ignored. The only thing is it was in the middle of summer and about 116 that afternoon. They needed to boost the air conditioning as the food was hot and so was the weather. I can't wait to visit again.

dxiwm4-2fJREQdvs5_D2MQ.text: Craving for curry so searched for this one. It was surprisingly awesome. REALLY PURE AUTHENTIC INDIAN FOOD. You gotta try! Hookah bar next door!
